updates.update_userinfo: This One Is The State of Things
updates.update_content:
Today when I got to the office, I resumed my quest to “make black smoke” particles. Most explosives generate black smoke and while I was able to create respectable white smoke like nobody’s business, no matter how black I painted source textures, the particles were always white when viewed in the game.
But this morning I figured it out and like almost always, it was something stupid that I missed. And as always, in hindsight, creating these things is trivially easy—when you know what tiny, tucked away parameter you are supposed to manipulate. I expect these “oh, you idiot” revelatory moments at least once a day.

campaign.story:
Vote for Eterium on Greenlight
Check out our Demo!
Stay up to date on development progress at Rogue Earth!
What is Eterium?
As a big fan of space sim games, I've been waiting many years for a Wing Commander or X-Wing style game to come along! I miss the days of hanging out in the rec room and talking to my wingmen before flying a mission.  I don't really care much for the economy sim aspect, such as commodity trading and ship purchasing, that has found its way into many modern space sims.  Neither am I satisfied with arcade-style games at the other extreme.  I was looking for a story-driven game that concentrated on being a pilot and part of something larger than myself.  I realized that if I was going to play a modern version of the classic space sim, I would have to create it myself. 

I set out developing Eterium about five years ago in my free time,  building it on a custom engine, while holding down a fulltime gameplay programming position. This made for a very slow moving process.  The gameplay was coming along nicely, but the graphics left much to be desired. That's when Dave joined the team and took the graphics to a new level.  Eterium is the story-driven classic space sim that I had been waiting for.

We've come along way since Dave joined the team!
We already have thirty-five missions up to a beta quality, but as you can see from our Demo there is still a lot of room for improvement. That is why we are turning to the kickstarter community to assist us in funding the completion of this game. With the funding we will be able to double the length of the game, polish the existing experience, improve the visuals, create new music and hire an artist to create better characters!
UEA Changdao Heavy Fighter - One of the four playable ships.
Eterium is an approachable and yet complex space sim game.  It is very important to us to design a game that can be easily picked up by new players.  There are many space sims out there that have such a steep learning curve, that it is really difficult for new players to start out.  Eterium's goal is to have a pick up and play feel while preserving the hardcore spirit of the genre.  The difficulty in Eterium is not in learning to fly your ship, but in learning to manage the encounters.  On harder difficulties the AI becomes more cunning and more difficult, but the AI will never cheat.  Weapons always do the same amount of damage and the AI's ships always have the same limitations no matter what difficulty the game is set to.
The United Earth Alliance Strike Carrier Canopus
Each missions starts with your ship on the flightdeck.
A few key features:  
Fully customizable joystick, Xbox controller, and mouse support.
Dynamic difficulty that allows the game to continually fine tune the AI skill level in addition to the standard game difficulty settings.
Four playable fighters with unique cockpit designs.
First person view from within the cockpit.
Procedural Missions: Many of the missions are created using an intelligent mission generation algorithm making each play through unique.
Advanced Damage System: In addition to shields and armor, there is an advanced damage system that governs the ship's functions. From weapons to engines the damaged system affects how the ship handles in combat.
Nvidia 3D Vision Support: The game looks awesome with a 3D monitor. If you have a 3D monitor you can't pass this game up!


Estimated System Requirements
The requirements are all subject to change. We’re trying to accommodate as many machines as possible.
OS: Windows (XP/Vista/7/8) 
Processor: 2ghz Core 2 Duo 
Memory:512 MB
Graphics: Shader Model 3.0 or better (Integrated graphics not supported, Nvidia card and 3D Vision setup required for Nvidia 3D Vision) 
Minimum (officially supported) Resolution: 1280 x 720

Asteroid fields are a good challenge - combat in asteroid fields is exhilarating!
Demo
Check out our demo. This is the first few missions from an early beta build to give you a taste of what you can expect from Eterium. http://rogueearth.com/Demo
We are working to improve the look of the characters and make them better match up with the rest of the game. We have not decided if we are going to stick with the anime style or go for a more realistic look.
Why Kickstarter?
If you haven't played our demo yet, I encourage you to give it a try. You'll see how far along we have come so far. We have been working on Eterium as a side project; but after hearing from all of you, we have realized that with some funding we could make Eterium something truly great.  We have put a lot of time and effort into making Eterium what it is today, but there is only so far that we can take it on our own.  The funding we receive from kickstarter will go toward hiring an artist to improve interactive story elements (characters and backgrounds), musicians to create custom music tracks, better sound fx and completing the development of the game.
Capital ships add challenge and variety to the game.
The Team
Eterium started a few years back as a side project from the Lead Programmer Andrew Luby. Andrew has since dedicated himself full-time to seeing this project through to completion.
Dave Schoneveld, the Lead Artist, joined the team about a year and a half ago; also contributing to Eterium as a side project. Dave saw the state of Eterium, and how much potential it showed, but knew the graphics would never make the cut. He worked to replace all the graphics in the game and bring the visuals to a level they are today.
Eric Duhon has been provided additional programming help throughout the last half a year. He has brought Eterium into stereo 3D with Nvidia 3D vision, greatly improved the graphics capability of the engine, and provided advanced joystick support.
Matt Roseman flimed and edited the Kickstarter video. Thanks Matt!
Scott Sorenson and Chris Murguia have recently signed on to create the custom music for Eterium. (The music they are creating has not yet made it into the demo).
Refinements of the corvette light capital ship.
Goals ($25,000) - Estimated Release October 2013
Complete the game.  The funding from kickstarter will give us the time we need to dedicate ourselves to finishing the missions, improving the graphics and particle effects, polishing the game, and play testing to deliver the best experience possible upon release.
Double the game's length from around 35 missions to 70 or more. That will take you about 12 to 16 hours to play through! Our original plan was to release the game in two parts, simply because it was so much work to create the first 35 missions.  But with the help of kickstarter we will have more time to develop the missions and tell the entire story with a single release.
Add a fourth playable ship with new cockpit: the Saber, an experimental new medium fighter that has more firepower than the Sagaris Medium Fighter but has handling characteristic closer to the Talwar Light Fighter.
Rework the character art. We're looking to hire a character artist to create new characters. We have not decided which style we want to go for yet, but we are leaning toward a gritty cartoon style and away from anime. We'd love to hear your suggestions in the comments!
Improved sound FX and completely custom music tracks. We are already working with new musicians to create custom music for Eterium. We'd also like to be able to improve the sound effects as well.
Detailed flight manual with ships stats, pilot biographies and tips for playing the game all told from the perspective of the characters in the game.

Stretch Goals
There are many additional things we'd like to do for Eterium that we simply cannot budget under the amount we are asking for.  $25,000 is the bare minimum that we need to complete the project and get the game in your hands.  But if we earn beyond our goal, we'll have additional funding to support:
$50,000 (add 2 months to estimated release)
Fully voiced dialog both during cinematics and in-flight gameplay.
Earn in-game medals for outstanding performance.
Improved joystick support and performance, including support for foot pedals.
3rd person view.
In-flight power and shield allocation
Customizable missile load-outs (later missions)

$75,000 (add 2 more months to estimated release)
Branching storyline.  With a branching storyline, your success in the missions effects the story and the outcome of the game!
Full Oculus Rift Support with head tracking and 360 degree cockpits.
Advanced camera controls including target-lock and looking around the cockpit.

The Beta Program
Those of you who sign up for the beta program will be helping us out tremendously by playing the game while we develop it. You'll be able to work directly with us to help us balance the game and tweak the missions and story so that we can provide the best experience possible. Those who sign up for the beta program will get their beta copy as soon as the kickstarter campaign ends. The beta version of the game you get, will not be complete. You will get about 30 playable missions at first, but as we work on the game you will receive regular updates to the beta version. That way you will be able to see the game evolve and be part of the decision process every time we add a new mission or change how a certain ship handles.
Stay up to date at our Developer Blog.
Add-ons
To get add-ons please pledge the amount listed below in addition to your current selected reward tier.  Send me a private message with which add-on(s) you would like and I will take note of it.
All Tiers: 
Add: $5 - Add 2 Exclusive digital wallpapers (included in the $35 tier)
Add: $5 - Add a high resolution digital poster (ideal for printing) (included in the $50 tier)
Add: $10 - Add a digital sound track (mp3 format) (included in the $60 tier)
Add: $15 - A second digital copy of the game for family or a friend.
Physical Tiers Only:
Add: $15 - Physical copy of the Sound Track 
 Add: $25 - An additional physical copy of the game.
(Outside US, please add $5 per physical item for shipping)

What is Dark Skies?
Dark Skies is an aerial combat wargame. In each turn both players move their miniatures, perform manoeuvres and attack each other measuring and rolling the dice. 
The miniature’s stand allow the miniatures go up and down representing 3 altitude levels, each level have its advantages and disadvantages.
Altitude diagram.

A Vikers Warfly prototype
The miniatures will be made in resin, to keep the models highly detailed and light. All models will require assembly and are supplied un-painted, also every model will include a base and a telescopic stand.
Dark Skies' games can go from a small skirmish to gigantic battles with dozens of aircraft in each side, hunting down enemies in intense dogfights and bombing vital targets.

campaign.story:
So listen, two hours is considered a lonnnng running time for a documentary feature, especially for a niche cinema doc. But despite being *over* two hours, a 2012 cinema documentary called EUROCRIME! THE ITALIAN COP AND GANGSTER FILMS THAT RULED THE '70s got selected by film festivals all around the world, garnered Top Festival Picks by newspapers like the SAN FRANCISCO BAY GUARDIAN, won other festival honors, received positive reviews in publications like VARIETY, and received multiple distribution offers.
EUROCRIME's documentarian, Mike Malloy, diligently edited his doc to pack in so much information, energy, style and creativity that the two-hour running time was accepted by audiences. The net effect? He was able to tell the story of the subject DEFINITIVELY.
Malloy has been researching his next doc project, PLASTIC MOVIES REWOUND: THE STORY OF THE '80s HOME VIDEO BOOM, since 2003. And when the project's sizzle reel debuted a couple months ago, the advanced buzz and reviews seemed to understand that while other, similar projects may use the word "definitive," this one means it.
Serialized across six half-hour episodes, PLASTIC MOVIES REWOUND will cover (1) Cultural Shake-Up, (2)  Industry Shake-Up, (3) Golden Age of Mom-and-Pop Video Stores, (4) Alternative Formats and Delivery Methods, (5) Filmmakers Versus Distributors and (6) the Future of Physical Media.
The project has about 20 interviews in the can already, from important industry players like the founder of Netflix and the former VP of RCA (that was involved with the company's failed CED format) to colorful low-budget and shot-on-video genre directors. Have a few more interviewees attached that we'd like to pick up.
So we're seeking to raise money in order to continue a little more production then jump headlong into post, where there's an 8TB raid drive that needs to be bought, etc.
This doc series will feature original synth music by composer Matthew Miklos (from the notorious garage rock band The Lyres) and a mix of original and licensed synth music from amazing Swedish composer Thomas Nyholm. Second Unit director Michael Perkins (THE BOOKER) is working on the dramatic re-enactments. Associate Producer Jonathan Hickman is both a camera op/DP and an entertainment attorney. Associate Producer Michael A. Martinez is a camera op/DP with some major Hollywood credits. Associate Producer Travis Mace is one of the hardest-working guys in the VHS collecting subculture. Associate Producer Morgan White (THE REP) has been helpful as hell in a number of ways.
But enough about the project; I want to tell you what you'll be getting if you donate at the exciting MILLENNIUM PLATINUM SIGNATURE EDITION level, which is meant to be a great value to the collectors. $75 will get you one item from each category:
SIGNED MOVIES:

Demon Queen (Massacre DVD, signed by director Donald Farmer)
Death Collector (RaeDon VHS, signed by director Tom Garrett)

Death Collector (MNTEX VHS, signed by director Tom Garrett)
Savage Vengeance (Eden DVD, signed by director Donald Farmer)

more coming...
SIGNED NON-MOVIE ITEMS:

Portable Grindhouse book (signed by author Jacques Boyreau -- multiple available!)
Videophile magazine issues (signed by publisher Jim Lowe -- multiple available!)
Splatter Times magazine (signed by publisher Donald Farmer)
more coming...


MYSTERY ITEMS:
Includes relevant-to-this documentary DVDs, vintage press materials, etc etc etc -- donated by filmmakers, by Vagrancy Films, Cult Movie Mania, Massacre Video, Lunchmeat Magazine, Slasher // Video and others!
MP3 SOUNDTRACK DOWNLOADS:
Several MP3s from Matthew Miklos and a couple from Thomas Nyholm.
A COPY OF THE FINISHED DOC:

Risks and challenges
Film projects always contain so many variables and moving parts that it's impossible to predict exactly how one will unfold. But considering that I already have enough interviews in the can to tell this story (even if it's not quite 100% the way I want yet) it seems pretty certain that PLASTIC MOVIES REWOUND is on a glide path to completion. I currently have all the footage on a 1.5 TB external drive backed up to another drive. When I have an 8TB raid drive, I will mirror it down to two 4TB partitions to protect it from hard drive failure on one side or the other. That said, I suppose the drive could still get boosted during a burglary or ruined by a freak tornado that rips our house apart. All the signed movie- and memorabilia-type rewards will ship out immediately upon a successful finish of the campaign; I hope to have the doc itself finished in early 2014, and copies of it will ship out upon completion...

The Comic
Caustic Soda: A Year Future Narco Romance is a comic book series written by Shane Roeschlein and illustrated by Daniel Crosier. Caustic Soda is an action-driven graphic novel set in San Diego, CA in a speculative future where a war for control of the border has erupted between the unified narcotics syndicates of Mexico and the Paramilitary Security Corporation, Agility. 
The narrative follows the work of the Arnelle Liquidation Associates, a group of freelance assassins whose base of operations is a punk rock club called The InterZone, where they dispose of their victims. 
The dangerous work performed by the kill-for-hire team affects both sides of the conflict, blurring the lines of loyalty, friendship and love. 
Protagonist Anton Nevona is an analyst for Agility Inc. and a liaison to the Arnelle Liquidation Associates, brokering targeted kills for the highest bidder. He also has a unique skill, using his Ouroboros ocular implant he can hack into a persons brain, reveal information and gain access to memories. Despite a simmering addiction to an entheogenic stimulant called bLoom (which filters his perceptions and effects his actions), Nevona finds himself implicated in a terrorist attack and accidentally amputates his thumb in the middle of a Department of Homeland Security raid, all before breakfast.
Daniel Crosier illustrates the comic by hand, using ink and graphite on birch wood panels. 
Client Services Department at the Arnelle Liquidation Associates
Cover artist Sonny Kay has incorporated imagery and themes inspired by the narrative, rendering a powerful and striking cover. 
Cover by Sonny Kay
Money 
Our book is 100% creator owned and funded. Our goal is to print and publish Caustic Soda - A Year Future Narco Romance as a complete 76-page graphic novel.
The money raised from the Kickstarter campaign will go toward production, printing and shipping and will also supplement creation of the rewards and fulfillment for our contributors. Our contributors will receive some incredible items from an array of artists including, Daniel Crosier (birch panel pages from Caustic Soda), Sonny Kay (Art Print of cover), BobRob Medina (custom, woodblock print Loteria Character Cards) and Joe Triscari (collectors edition t-shirt). 
Remember, Kickstarter is an all-or-nothing system, if we don't get 100% funded in the allotted time frame, Caustic Soda - A Year Future Narco Romance won't be made. This crowd sourced art patronage using kickstarter has supported many amazing projects, from comics to films to handy little pieces of tech like the Makey Makey (arduino WIN!). 
The Creators 
Shane Roeschlein is a writer living in San Diego, CA. His short stories have appeared in the Journal of Experimental Fiction, Fiction International, Pacific Review, and Black Scat Books. His short story, Genesis was nominated for the 2012 Pushcart Prize. He is also a contributor at Noisey.com and a columnist for wholebeastrag.com. 
Dan Crosier is an illustrator, filmmaker and artist from Denver, CO. Crosier is known for wood burning & mixed media comic art, illustrating Bartholomew of the Scissors, as well as writing and illustrating Vincent Price Presents and the Distortions Unlimited. Crosier also writes the Show Devils books featuring the sideshow performers the Enigma and Serana Rose. 
Sonny Kay is best known for his visual art contributions and cover album art for bands such as The Mars Volta, RX Bandits and Le Butcherettes and most recently and notably as creative director for independent record label, Sargent House. 
Sonny Kay's DMTMZMX
Gary Lain is the editor of Caustic Soda. He lives in San Diego, CA. He has published fiction and non-fiction in Fiction International, Review of Contemporary Fiction, American Book Review, Brooklyn Rail, Texas Review, Belphegor, Crash Test, Journal of Experimental Fiction.
Letterer Zach Meyer, is a web nerd living and working in Austin, TX. When he isn't trying to build the biggest and best websites or apps on the planet, he is given chances to leverage his background in layout, print, and graphic design on indy comics as a measure of fun guided by his friend Dan Crosier.
Book Specs
Caustic Soda - A Year Future Narco Romance is a graphic novel, with high quality, square bound, card stock cover and news print interior pages, available in English and Spanish.

http://www.mediafire.com/download/t458hps04wrrf51/GODF_Wingmen_Alpha_Preview.zip
"GoD Factory Wingmen was one of the more interesting titles I checked out at PAX"
 - TotalBiscuit
"Quite how multiplayer space-combat dogfighters vs capital-ship game GoD Factory: Wingmen hasn’t raised the mere $70,000 Kickstarter ask is beyond me."
 - Jim Rossignol, Rock Paper Shotgun
"The first game in 15 years that's going to make me buy a joystick for my PC"
 - James Portnow, Extra Credits
"Two of the hottest things in gaming right now are MOBAs and the Oculus Rift. When you take those two things and whip in a spicy dash of sci-fi space combat, it's hard not to get a tad excited. To the point of twitching."
 - Jarimor, ZAM
"There is nothing simple about GoD Factory. I got my first taste of the game at Pax East 2013, and I can truthfully say that the game is as deep as it is beautiful."
 - Alex Coccia, GreenlitGaming
What is GoD Factory: Wingmen?
GoD Factory: Wingmen is a multiplayer space combat game in which the player works with a team of up to three other players to destroy the opponent’s Carrier while defending their own.
Before joining online matches, the player assembles two gunships by individually selecting the twelve parts that compose each ship. These parts are bought from the game's shop using Credits earned by playing games online. Once in-game, the players must destroy different key areas of the enemy Carrier to incapacitate it and ultimately destroy it. Destroying a Carrier part gives penalties to the enemy team, and each broken part inflicts a different penalty. The key to victory will be to work as a team and many weapons and abilities will have secondary uses that can only be triggered by joining up with other players. A game should last about 15 minutes on average and can't stretch beyond 25 minutes. The game will be playable both in third person, to see your ship you've built, or from inside the cockpit, for greater immersion.
Vote for us on Greenlight!
This is primarily a PC game, but we're very open to the possibility of bringing the game to consoles if the opportunity arises. We will also have a Mac version, but it might not be available at launch. Linux is also a possibility, but no promise as of yet. Anyhow, you'll be happy to know that this game is not hardware intensive, so if you have a decent PC, even if it's a few years old, it should be able to run the game. We are working hard to make GoD Factory:Wingmen accessible to lots of people can play this game, without sacrificing the beauty of the visuals. We're already able to run the game quite decently on 5 years old laptops, so we're pretty confident that we'll be supporting a wide range of PCs.
Key features:
Many different gunship classes and parts to choose from;
Build 2 gunships and lend the one you're not using to your teammates or keep it for later; 
Different weapons and abilities are amplified by cooperating with your allies; 
Destroy the enemy Carrier part by part, taking away its abilities progressively; 
Complex weapon attributes provide a wide array of strategies to experiment.


A good game isn't just a set of features however, it's an experience, and it has to be approached like one. We're orienting ourselves on four key aspects of the experience that we'd like to deliver:
(Taken straight from the Game Design Document!)

Create: 
The player wants to feel that he's doing his own thing. He's crafting a ship that fits his preferences, he works on making a play style and strategy of his own. He wants to build his squad by joining like-minded players. Everything must come with a sense of ownership.

Fly: 
We need to convey a sense of mobility to the player. He must be picturing himself moving into a 3D space with both skill and freedom, the ability to go wherever he feels like. The movement of the ship and the camera must give to players the reflex to tilt their heads to follow their ship's motion. They want to feel “there”.

Cooperate: 
Any player wants to feel like he's playing an important part in his team. In order to do so, we must reward every actions done as a group and make sure that victory is achieved when everyone acts toward a common goal. In order to convince the player to be a team player, he must feel the presence of his allies in the fight.

Improve: 
An aspect that will hook our players is the strong sense of progression when playing the game. Not only will his ships become better as he plays, but learning the complex systems and the meta-game will always give him something more to learn. One reason to keep playing is that you always get better.
The Oculus Rift is a virtual reality headset that was immensely successful here on Kickstarter. VR replaces your vision by the environment of the game by placing monitors in front of each eye. Motion tracking and stereoscopic 3D make this even more convincing. 
Oculus Rift is not ideal for every game because it completely replaces your vision.  For a game with a character that moves and jumps, it can feel a bit awkward as the player is sitting in a chair.  However the experience from GoD: Wingmen is within a cockpit, creating the perfect environment for simulation.
It is our intent to support the Oculus Rift for GoD Factory and we hope that we'll be ready on time for launch.
Nine Dots is a team of 7 developers working full time. We've got two programmers, three artists, one game designer/studio manager and a recently added game designer. Most of us have been working on this game for a year now with no salary. Before that, we had worked on a different game, Brand for over a year, also with no salary. So needless to say, we're a bunch of extremely committed developers doing all we can to make a great games!
Nine Dots was created to fight back against management practices from the game industry which we think are holding us back. We want to change how we make games, and what games we make. We are vehemently against crunch time, we believe in building our own intellectual properties rather than working on the projects of others and we make sure that everyone has a meaningful creative input on the game. If you want to read more about this mission, we were featured in a related article on the Penny Arcade Report not long ago: http://penny-arcade.com/report/article/why-your-games-are-made-by-childless-31-year-old-white-men-and-how-one-stud
We are giving everything we have to make this project a reality. However, sometimes that's not enough. We have a very solid alpha, which was thoroughly enjoyed by hundreds over hundreds of people during PAX East, including TotalBiscuit! Dave Voyles, former Editor-in-Chief of Armless Octopus and coordinator of the XBLIG Indie Uprising, also had kind words regarding the game:
"The space shooter genre has been sorely missing in action since the critically acclaimed X-Wing vs. TIE Fighter in the early 90's. After my time with GoD Factory at PAX  East, I think GoD Factory is as close as we've come to that experience since so many years ago."
However, we might be unable to bring the game to completion. We've been working for 2 years at Nine Dots now, without salary. Our personal savings and resources are spreading thin, and even though we haven't paid ourselves salaries, we still have business related bills to pay. We have to pay for insurances, rent, licenses and many other things to sustain the business. We are surviving on a $25,000 bank loan, but that won't suffice.
Realistically, in order to put absolutely everything we'd like to havein GoD Factory: Wingmen, it would take around 300,000 dollars to pay for salaries, software licenses, servers, sound effects, music, marketing (we really need to populate our matches to make this game interesting!), rent, insurances, bank fees, accounting fees, etc. Obviously, the biggest chunk of that money would go to salaries so that we may sustain ourselves while we make the game.
However, we don't need all of that money *right now* to be able to progress. With 70,000 dollars, we'd have enough resources to at least bring the game to a sufficiently polished state to start the alpha funding process. Alpha funding is the principle of selling the incomplete game for less than it will cost once finished and using the feedback of early supporters to better polish the game and iron out the details. It's how Minecraft, Project Zomboid and Path of Exile funded their development, to name a few. It's a great way to leverage a community and funds, which are the two resources we need most to pull off this kind of game.
We are also currently under consideration for a loan from the Canada Media Fund to finish the game, but in order for them to back us, they require that we have a minimum of funds ourselves to invest in the project. So if we don't meet our Kickstarter goal, we pretty much have no chance of receiving their help either.

Here's a breakdown of what we can add to the game depending on how much we raise:
$70,000: We can bring the game to a polished enough state to start selling it following the alpha funding model. Features that might not be included when the alpha funding starts include some of the gunship parts, the progression system (all parts would be unlocked from the start), it will probably be still a little bugged and some balance issues, etc.
$100,000: If we reach that much, then we can guarantee that we'll make a different cockpit model for every species, which will be especially cool for Oculus. Of course, we'll also get closer to a more polished game for any amount above $70,000.
$150,000: The ability to choose between at least two different carriers, with very different layouts and major gameplay differences.
$200,000: We'd REALLY like to raise this much since we've been in talk with a famous composer to make music for our game, and we would be incredibly happy to have him do the soundtrack for our game.
$250,000: More complex levels, including space stations that must be captured to gain benefits for your team, such as power-ups.
$300,000: We'll have a clan-based ladder ranking system. We'll also be able to guarantee that we'll support the game for at least a year from launch. We'll put extra money into our servers and release the game early in August so people can start interacting with it, even if it's not final! That will also give the players a bigger say on how the game will turn out.
Straight from the first reward tier, you pre-order the game, for probably less than what it will cost at launch. So many things could happen during development though, so don't take the release date for granted. 

Many tiers give you access to exclusive content that will only be available to our backers, such as the Super-Gold material for your ships and some vanity items that alter the look of your ships in unique ways. The best rewards however allow the backers to directly influence the game's look for everyone to see. You get to change the game in a way that everyone will experience. We're also very open to suggestions! So if you'd like to contribute but you don't see the kind of reward you're looking for, just send us your suggestion and we'll see if we can make it happen. No promise here, but it's always worth a shot!
All our backers will also be thanked in the game's credits.
So here's a more detailed explanation for every reward tier.
$10 or more
This is exactly the same offer as $15, but for less. The thing is, it's a limited offer!
$15 or more
Pre-order the game. You get the game as soon as it's ready.
$35 or more
Pre-order 4 license for the game, meaning that you can assemble a full team with your friends. You also get two exclusive cosmetic additions that are only available to backers who paid enough to reach this tier: one is a Wing Lamp that adds some kind of flare effect in front of your ship, while the other is a highly reflective, Unique "Super-Copper" material that you can apply to any of your ships.
$50 or more
Add to the package a single access to the Beta, meaning that you get to try the game before everyone else, give us feedback on how to make the game better and start mastering the game before everyone else! You also get the exclusive "Super-Silver" material to apply to your ship and a vanity item that will add a blazing fire to your trails. Finally, you get one of four unique ships designed only for our backers. These ships are made from the three major ship parts, which are the wings, the hull and the cockpit. There is one unique ship per species.

UPDATE:
We will reveal the look of the exclusive ships as we make them in the FAQ!
$100 or more
Not only do you get all the previous rewards, you also get all future expansions and DLC to the game. We intend to support the game for a while and frequently update with new content, and it will all be available to you without spending one dime more. You also get all 4 unique ships, and the unique super-gold material to apply to your ship. You also gain access to a special plug-in that allows you to make your own holographic emblem, in a similar fashion to guild emblems in many MMOs. 
$250 or more
There are big billboards on space stations and satellites that will appear in some level environments. These billboards will shuffle through a bank of images. You get to provide us with an image of your choice (we need to approve of the image first) and your image will be displayed on those billboards. You would like to promote your own game? You want to make a joke to make our players laugh? You like kittens? Show it on our billboards!
You also get a vanity item that alters your ship by adding big Diamond gems to your ship.
500$ or more
You get to design your own stellar Constellation, which all players will see in the sky surrounding the battlefield. You will have a maximum of 12 stars for your constellation. Note that not every constellation will necessarily appear at the same time in every match.
You will also get a Vanity Item that produces an Ornate Luminous Halo on your ship.
$1000 or more
For this amount, you can either design a custom Planet that will be up for everyone to see in the game *or* a custom Vanity Item, similar to the other vanity rewards such as fire trails, diamond chunks, star flares in front of your wings, etc. Tell us what you'd like to see, if it's reasonable we'll do it. We won't do anything offensive or which concerns intellectual properties we do not own the rights to. The planet will not appear in every match and will be one of the randomly shuffled level element.
$2500 or more
Design a GoD Monument (instead of a Planet or a Vanity Item), which are absolutely ASTRONOMICAL statues or monuments. These colossi have a big visual impact on levels, even more so than planets or space stations, and will usually be the main piece in a level environment. Just like the planet, the GoD Monument will not appear in every match. It will be one of the random elements that composes a level's environment. Believe us, all players take notice when a GoD is there. In some cases, we might even be able to animate the GoD monument, depending on the complexity of the concept.
$5000 or more 
Design a new Carrier Cannon (instead of a planet, vanity item or GoD) This cannon will have its own unique shape and projectile special FX. You also choose whether this cannon will only appear on your side when you're part of a match, or if every player in the game has access to it.
$10000 or more 
For this much, we actually make a game that will be available in our game. In the Crew Quarter menu, where a player can see his stats, trophies and codex entries, there will be an arcade cabinet which can be selected to play a game. This game will be your idea, which must not take more than 2 weeks to make. We'll discuss this at length to make sure it ends up being something you're satisfied with, but you need to have realistic expectations. This arcade cabinet will be available for any player to try.
We need your help, and the simple fact that you're here reading this, that you've spent time considering our project or watched the video means a lot to us. If you like what we are doing but can't afford to contribute at the moment, know that you can help us a lot by simply talking about us and sharing our Kickstarter. We're very grateful for this kind of help as well and we know all too well that sometimes you're just strapped for cash and can't help this way.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Even if we meet our goal of $70,000, there is always a risk that development would not go as planned. We could start our Alpha funding model for sure, but if we don't receive enough support afterward, we might have to stop development before reaching the fully fleshed out game we want to make. That's a worst case scenario however, especially considering how far in development we already are.

With this being said, we've been extremely committed so far. Considering that we've been doing this for a year with no salary working on GoD Factory, I think it's pretty safe to think we can bring this project to completion if we get the cash and the support from our backers. We've completed a game project before and we know what it entails. We made mistakes with our first title and we do not intend to repeat them, so we are ready, more than ever, to take on this challenge.

There is also the risk that the game might turn out to be something different than what you expected. Games are subjective, so the experience will vary from player to player. No matter what, we intend to deliver the best product our resources will allow us to make.

But really... we have no intention of dropping the ball. Our entire company, Nine Dots is dedicated to this project alone, if the project does not succeed, neither will we. We're betting the farm on this project. So we'll do everything we can to be successful and worthy of your support.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Miss out on the Kickstarter? Fear not! You can still pre-order a lamp at 8bitlit.com

Relive Your 8-Bit Glory Days!
Don't you miss the good old days? The days of long summers, few responsibilities, and plenty of time to play.  
A timeless symbol of our 8-bit glory days, the Question Block Lamp brings back everything we love most about old school gaming.  
Simple mechanics: Tap the bottom to turn on and off. Whether you use your fist, palm, or head is up to you.
Addictive sound effects: You'll be rewarded with gold coins and the occasional 1-up each time you interact with the lamp.  
Nostalgia-inducing design: Energy efficient LEDs and retro graphics add that warm, familiar glow to your space, day or night.
Perfect for any room
Whether you hang it in your bedroom, boardroom or bathroom, you can’t go wrong. We use the highest quality parts and construction so it’ll look and sound amazing year in and year out.
Ridiculously Simple Setup
Setting up your Question Block Lamp is easier than connecting an RCA jack.
Simply hang with the enclosed mounting kit and plug in the super long 20' power cord.
If you'd prefer to set your Question Block Lamp on your desk, table or night stand, be sure to grab the matching solid aluminum stand (optional). Perfect for offices and cranky landlords!
Our Story
When makers are around, every open-bar Christmas party is bound to turn into a brainstorm. 
We got to talking about ideas, and DaDING! We came up with the concept for a fun, interactive gadget that brought back a time when 8 bits were all you needed.
The next two weeks went by in a blur of superglued fingertips and solder smoke, but at the end with had our first Question Block Lamp!
We eagerly shared our creation with our family, friends, and coworkers, and the response was overwhelming! Everyone loved the lamp and wanted one for themselves.  
A few days later, we listed our first lamp on Etsy. To our surprise and delight, Drew Olanoff (formerly of The Next Web) found our listing and wrote an amazing review! In the months that followed, we received great press in publications like G4TV, Gizmodo, Joystiq, Bloomberg, the Wall Street Journal and more. 
All the attention led to a lot of sales - over 1,000! We recruited a team of skilled makers to help us fulfill all the orders. 
Why Kickstarter? (Question Block Lamp 2.0)
In July 2012, we stopped production of the Question Block Lamp to design a new version. We wanted it to be more robust, reliable, and manufacturable at scale. Here’s how the next generation lamp will be even better than before:
Electronics Upgrade: (Warning: Geek Speak!) To make the lamp more reliable and sensitive to touch, we've integrated the capacitive touch sensor into the circuit board. Now it's super sensitive, activating instantaneously with a single fingertip.
Stronger construction: We’ve selected tougher materials and production techniques to be even more resilient to wear, tear, and supercharged uppercuts. Originally we used acrylic, which is great for lasercutting, but very brittle, meaning the lamps were somewhat fragile. The new version will be made of polyvynil chloride (PVC) which is more resilient and can be die cut. 
Longer power cord: To ensure your lamp can hang in any room, we’ve extended the power cord from 11 feet to 20 feet.
Easy to install mounting kit: Every lamp now includes a mounting kit so you can get set up in no-time. This will ensure the cord hugs your wall and ceiling. 
Matching aluminum stand: For the Kickstarter, we've developed a durable aluminum stand that complements the lamp, and lets you place it on any flat surface. (Surface finish will be powder-coated or annodized - TBD) 
In order to deliver this new version of the lamp, we need your support to make a minimum order to the factory.
Light up your life at a Special Kickstarter Price
If the Kickstarter is successful, we'll have enough funds to scale up production and lower the price to $49 (originally $75 plus shipping).
Today we have everything lined up to begin production in a modern, safe and clean facility overseas -- all we need is your support. With your pledge, we'll start production and deliver high-quality lamps at a great price. 
At the $125 pledge level we’re offering a small run of Limited Edition lamps, handcrafted in San Francisco. These lamps will be Version 2.0 and include all the new upgrades. Each lamp will include a unique laser etched identification number and ship shortly after the Kickstarter closes.
Rewards:
Production Schedule
  Pre Kickstarter
January 2012: Created first prototype
February-July 2012: Handmade and sold lamps on Etsy
August 2012-May 2013: Worked with manufacturers to redesign lamp, and enable large scale production.
June-July 2013: Kickstarter campaign
  Post Kickstarter
August 2013: Visit manufacturers, produce handmade Limited Edition lamps in San Francisco
September 2013:  Oversee first units off the line
October 2013: Lamps and stands ship to fulfillment center
November 2013: Lamps and stands are delivered to Kickstarter backers
Special Thanks:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In addition to building and shipping over 1,000 lamps over the past year, we've also been establishing relationships with experienced manufacturers and sourcing experts to help mitigate as many risks as possible. We will always be in communication about any challenges along the way, including:

Ship date: We have built extra time into the project plan and are confident in our ability to ship on time, but it's possible things take longer than planned.

Manufacturing: We have an established relationship with an experienced and highly reputed manufacturer. In addition, we will be on-site at the facility to oversee production and ensure quality control.

Special Edition Lamps: We're bringing back the same team that created the first 1,000 lamps. Each of them has gone on to do awesome things, but they're coming back to produce this run, just for you!

At 8-Bit Lit, we're committed to delivering a great experience. Thanks so much for your support!

Adam and Bryan
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Backers, hope you've had a great year!
We've been busy manufacturing our second run of lamps, which are available today! 
If you'd like to purchase another, looking for a great gift for the holiday, or have friends who might be interested, please head over to www.8bitlit.com.
We're also offering a 10% discount for the next week if you use the code: COINSAVER.

There are likely some lamps still getting to their destinations. These will be more isolated international countries.
If for some reason you still haven't received your lamp, email concerns@8bitlit.com. Thanks!

We manufactured the lamp with the intent that it will last forever. I know that's a bold statement, but I mean it. LEDs don't have a simple lifespan estimate (it depends on application), and you've got 4 of them in there to last you quite a while. 
For the geeky, it helps that we're not using PWM on the lights.
Try not to break it, but just in case, we'll be making a lot more ; )

Dear Backers,
The past 7 months working with you have been exhausting, but worth it. Thank you for your patience and appreciation. I'm personally sorry about logistical errors, electrical problems with the lamp, and flaws in design. FYI for those with electrical issues, just power it off a battery. It will also be affected by humidity and temperature. We didn't account for these due to time constraints. Also, I'd advise not uppercutting it. The bottom is sensitive to cracking due to the glue joint between the circuit board and the plastic. Finally, if you shoot the bottom with a Nerf gun, it will turn on and off. Have fun : )

Hey backers, Happy New Year! We hope you all had a wonderful break with your friends and families. 
A couple weeks ago, I did a podcast with the blog Darkstation. We chatted about the Kickstarter and manufacturing process, as well as some videogame geekery. 
Hope you enjoy: listen here

updates.update_userinfo: 2,400 lamps shipped! Time for a break.
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
It's been a crazy week, but we managed to get 2,400 lamps out into the world. We've heard that there were a few damaged shipments, and some upside-down question marks, so we're doing our best to get things replaced.
If you're in the US, everything should be arriving before Christmas. We're really sorry if UPS takes longer than expected. There are often issues with weather that cause minor delays.

Hey everyone, the container arrived this morning! 
Unfortunately, our forklift didn't, so we had to improvise. Check out the time-lapse video we made!

Hey everyone! Big news.
Just a few hours ago, the lamps cleared US Customs! I'm about to get on a flight to Los Angeles, and will be meeting the container at our warehouse tomorrow morning.
Pics and more to come!
Adam

Hey backers. We just received word that our shipment is going through an additional customs search called an MET exam. 
The good news is that we can get the container out of the port today. The bad news is that it needs to be delivered to an offsite testing facility, where the government will do a screening. Apparently shipments are chosen through random selection, but it's likely that we've been selected due to first time shipping.

Hey backers! Hope you all had a fantastic Thanksgiving, or just a great week if turkey wasn't on the menu.
After a long trip across the Pacific Ocean, your lamps are right at the US doorstep. The shipment is scheduled to arrive in Los Angeles tomorrow night, but will be held in customs at least until Thursday. 
Our hope is that we'll receive them by the end of the week, but customs is unpredictable, and we can't get any guarantees up front. From talking to others who have gone through the process, it can vary from a day or two, up to a week.

campaign.story:
PREVIOUSLY
Roadkill du Jour #1 (funded on Kickstarter in April, 2013) chronicled the awful plight of a devastated biker afflicted with the curse to eat only that which dies on the road...and to then assume the traits of the very creature which he consumed! This biker, duJour, longed to recover the soul of his lost wife and gain vengeance against the voodoo witch who hexed him and murdered his gang.
Get the WHOLE Story: TO ADD A STANDARD COPY OF ROADKILL DU JOUR #1 TO ANY REWARD TIER, SIMPLY ADD $5 AND MESSAGE US AT THE "CONTACT ME" LINK TO THE RIGHT!
THE STORY IN ISSUE #2
In this second chapter, duJour recruits avenging weapons in the forms of NEW misfit members of his Roadkill Motorcycle Club, all the while watched and warded by the witch, Mama Houdoo, and her legion of horrific minions!
The Kickstarter-Exclusive, 1970's Exploitation, Movie Poster-Style Cover to Roadkill du Jour #2 - Available Beginning at the $12 Tier!
Roadkill du Jour is a tale of motorcycle gangs in a mystic bayou world, clashing in an explosion of vengeance and voodoo. At the heart of it all is the enigmatic loner, DuJour, by all counts a victim...of fate, of changes, and - most of all - of the black magic-wielding Mama Houdoo, dark mistress of the rival Gatorbait Motorcycle Club! Our story is that of duJour's quest to rid himself of his curse(s) and gain some satisfaction at the expense of Mama and her ilk.
But, the story behind the story goes back a couple of years. Writer Kevin LaPorte concocted its foundation during road trips to comic conventions supporting horror comic Clown Town amidst discussions with the illustrious artist of that project, Amanda Rachels. LOTS of dead critters on the road in the Southeast U.S. where we were driving, and those times were at the height of Sons of Anarchy couture. Thus, an off-hand comment like, "What if there was a hero who got animal powers from eating roadkill," became the high concept of a badass biker who HAD to eat the roadkill due to a voodoo curse placed on him by a rival gang priestess! TA-DAAAAA! Roadkill du Jour!
The Standard Cover to Roadkill du Jour #2 - Available in Print at the $10 Reward Tier!
THE PREVIEW
Here is a look at the first four FINISHED pages of Roadkill du Jour #2!
Page 1 of Roadkill du Jour #2!
Page 2 of Roadkill du Jour #2!
Page 3 of Roadkill du Jour #2!
Page 4 of Roadkill du Jour #2!
THE PROJECT
Roadkill du Jour #2 is the next 20-page chapter of a 4-issue story.  Funds collected will go first to fees, taxes, printing and production of books and rewards, and fulfillment (shipping, supplies, etc.).  Any funds remaining beyond those expenses will go toward compensating the creators, marketing and distributing the project (via print, digital and personal appearances at conventions and retailers), and expanding the size of the print run (dependent upon demand).
The Standard Cover to Roadkill du Jour #1 - Available by adding just $5 to ANY Reward Tier!
LOYALTY REWARD:
EVERY Backer of THIS campaign (non-PDF tiers) who previously backed Flesh of White #'s 1 or 2 or Roadkill du Jour #1 will also receive a UNIQUE SKETCH Trading Card for DUJOUR, with actual pencil art by a Roadkill du Jour artist, Shawn Harbin or Laura Guzzo, or Flesh of White artist, Amanda Rachels!
duJour Sketch Card - Loyalty Reward! Available to ALL previous backers of Flesh of White or Roadkill du Jour Kickstarter Campaigns!
THE WRITER:
The Writer of Roadkill du Jour - Kevin LaPorte
Kevin LaPorte is the Mobile, Alabama-based writer and co-creator of genre comics with a horror bent - Roadkill du Jour, Clown Town, The Blind Eye!  The worlds Kevin creates range from dark carnivals overrun by killer clowns violently avenging abused children (Clown Town) to dying frontier towns in the Old West beset by Steampunk versions of the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse (the in-development Last Ride for Horsemen) to the bayou territory of a lone motorcycle gangster seeking vengeance for his cursed appetite for street meat and the slaughter of his brothers-in-arms (Roadkill du Jour)!  Kevin also contributed poetry and lyrics to Ancients & Warriors: The Sketch Art of Gavin Michelli, featuring the figure work of collaborator, Gavin Michelli.
THE ARTIST:
The Artist of Roadkill du Jour - Shawn Harbin
Shawn Harbin is an enigmatic writer and artist mostly known for his work on The Dungeon Comic. The man himself is saturated with sardonic wit and pragmatic rants railing against man’s failure to live up to the laws of natural selection. Highly influenced by artists Todd McFarlane, John Romita Sr., Humberto Ramos, Frank Cho, Jay Leisten, and Jeff Koonz, Shawn’s talents as a penciler and storyteller are stimulated by some of the best in and out of the comic art world. His art is a mixture of hot babes, intelligent monsters, and campy humor wrapped in twisted darkness and highly innovative layouts.
THE COLORIST:
The Colorist of Roadkill du Jour - Laura Guzzo
Laura Guzzo is a freelance illustrator whose award-winning artwork has been featured in galleries across the East Coast. Laura enjoys working in many different media, including colored pencils, watercolor, and collage. She draws inspiration from tarot cards and stained glass, as well as from 1950's pin-up girls and the art nouveau movement. Laura currently works out of a studio in South Jersey. Her most recent projects include Shakespeare Shaken (Red Stylo Media) and PrinceLess (Action Lab Comics). To see more, visit: www.LauraGuzzoArt.com
THE KICKSTARTER PEDIGREE
Kevin has led EIGHT previous, successful Kickstarter campaigns, including that for Roadkill du Jour #1: four for his serialized horror graphic novel, Clown Town, as well as another for Ancients & Warriors: The Sketch Art of Gavin Michelli, and he organized the recent campaigns for Erica Heflin and Amanda Rachels' Flesh of White #'s 1& 2! We are experienced and reliable creators and purveyors of comics via Kickstarter. You will get what you pledge for and get it quickly!
THE REWARDS:
Full details on each reward tier are outlined to the right, of course!  We're offering Roadkill du Jour #2 in multiple versions, including the Standard Cover, a Kickstarter-Exclusive 70's Exploitation Cover, a HUGE Treasury-Sized (9.25” x 14”) Edition, and a Blank Sketch Cover – COMPLETE with Limited Color Sketch by Series Artist Shawn Harbin!
Extras we've devised EXCLUSIVELY for this campaign include a set of Trading Cards featuring main characters and a 16-page Behind-the Scenes companion book, which features top secret information from Kevin, Shawn & Laura on the development and production of the story and art for Roadkill du Jour!
The Mama Houdoo Trading Card - Available with Roadkill du Jour #2 Beginning at the $10 Reward Tier!
The CHAYA Trading Card - Available EXCLUSIVELY at the $35 Subscription & $100 Completist Reward Tiers!
There are also opportunities to get original art by Shawn Harbin and Laura Guzzo, both in the form of custom commissions!
The 9" x 12" ORIGINAL ART for the duJour Trading Card by Shawn Harbin - Available at the $25 Reward Tier!
Mama Houdoo by Laura Guzzo - An Example of the Amazing Custom Art Available from Laura at the $30 Reward Tier!
Dragon Girl by Shawn Harbin - An Example of the Amazing Commissions Available at the $60 Reward Tier!
Lawnmower Cowboy by Shawn Harbin - Another Example of the Unique Commissions Available at the $60 Reward Tier!
THE STRETCH GOALS:
Once we have exceeded the minimum funding goal of $2000, there will be opportunities to add to the rewards available as we reach higher levels of funding:
$2500 - The Mama Houdoo Trading Card for ALL non-PDF Reward Tiers $10 and Up!
$3000 - A NEW Trading Card for ALL non-PDF Reward Tiers $10 and Up!
$3500 - 4 Additional Pages of Bios/Profiles of Main Characters!

campaign.story:
A few years ago, it seemed like there was a comic-con in every major city in North America. Every major city except Washington, DC, at least. So we asked around. Was there a reason nobody had put on a big comic-con in the Washington Convention Center? Nobody knew why, it just hadn't been done. We got tired of waiting for somebody else to deem DC worthy of a con, and we did it ourselves. If you were one of the 7,000+ people who came out to Awesome Con in April, I hope you felt like you were part of something truly special, because you were. 
This is what it's all about!!
It is obvious that the District should be the home of a premier national comic-con. A comic-con worthy of the District of Columbia and the entire DC Metro Area. We could wait around for some multi-million dollar corporation to do it, or, as fans who also know a thing or two about running a convention, we can do it ourselves, with your help. We promise to run it from a fans-first perspective, with the help and support of the fan community.
Our plan is to bring you the biggest show this area has ever seen, on April 19-20, 2014. Over 100,000 square feet of exhibitors, artists, comic pros, and celebrities. More than twenty rooms of programming, and since we're not some huge corporate behemoth, we can keep ticket prices reasonable.
But we're going to need your help to do it. 
At this moment, Awesome Con is in about the same place financially as it was last year when we started planning the first Awesome Con. Basically, we can afford to put on the exact same show we did last time. That's not really going to work for 2014. We sent out surveys after the con, and over 95% of them said the same thing: MAKE IT BIGGER. We can make it bigger. We will make it bigger. But making it bigger presents a few challenges.
Specifically, we need more money to rent a larger convention hall, which is probably the most pressing and most obvious issue. We will also need to hire a few employees to help manage the whole thing. This is something that will require a full year's worth of work from a team of people, or it just can't happen. So that's why we're coming to Kickstarter. Our other options are to borrow money from a bank or to find a rich investor, but neither of those options serves the fans well, and serving geekdom is priority #1. If we can run this as a project on Kickstarter, you will be guaranteed to have the most absolutely fan-friendly show that's ever happened. 
This is how packed the panels were in April! We need more space!
This Kickstarter campaign is about creating an awesome experience for one weekend next year, and so the #1 thing we want to emphasize is that by backing us, you will be coming to the con. Every reward we offer involves admission to Awesome Con DC 2014. And you won't just be contributing money to the con, we'll take your input along the way while we're planning the con. Also, all Backers will get a swag bag with an exclusive con badge, an exclusive comic book, a show program with your name listed in the Backers' section, and an invitation to the Backers Only Panel at Awesome Con DC. This panel will probably be the greatest single fan event of all time. We've got some cool ideas for it, but they're top secret for now. 
If we raise more than our goal, the extra money will go toward making the con bigger and better. We'll get more famous (and more expensive) guests. We'll do more special stuff after hours. The more you contribute to this campaign, the more you are helping to make Awesome Con even more awesome. 
EDIT 7/1/13: We've added two cool new benefits for all backers. 
1) Friday Preview Night. We will open the doors to the con in the late afternoon or evening for a preview of the con. All Kickstarter backers at Concerned Citizen or higher will get into Preview Night for no extra charge. We will probably put a limited number of tickets on sale for Preview NIght, but if you're a backer you get in for free. If we have enough backers (at this point it doesn't look like we will have enough), we will make it so that ONLY backers are allowed in on Preview Night. Either way, this will be a fantastic Friday to come to the con. It's a holiday weekend, traffic and parking in DC will be as good as you could possibly hope for on a weekday.
2) After the Kickstarter campaign ends, we will send out the link to our room block at the Renaissance to backers at least one week before we publish the link on our website. Our rate is $139 + tax, that's the best rate I've ever seen at that hotel. Maybe they're trying to build a relationship with us because there's a new hotel opening up next year next to the Convention Center. I don't know, but $139 per night at a downtown DC four-star hotel is amazing, and it's within walking distance to the con (it's just across the square). I know it's not a huge perk, but if you're planning to travel to the con it can save you a few hundred dollars.
These two added benefits will ONLY happen if the Kickstarter campaign is funded. The con will still happen if we aren't funded, but we may have to scale back a few things that we want to do if we have to look somewhere else for funding. It will be Awesome regardless.
GUESTS
George Pérez will be at Awesome Con!
The biggest question we've been asked so far is about guests. And the best answer for that question is that George Pérez will be at Awesome Con 2014. We are also talking to a lot more fantastic comics and media guests. Unfortunately, we can't announce any media guests to go along with this campaign. Due to filming schedules, most movie and TV actors won't be able to book earlier than 4-6 months before the con. We are in contact with a number of agents about a number of guests, and as their schedules permit, we will be confirming them. We are also in touch with a number of high-profile comic guests, and we can announce a few right now, and as we confirm them, we will continue to announce more. We expect a relatively large number of media guests (between 20-30), and even more comic guests.

REWARDS
Note: You can totally change your reward level at any time, if we've added a new one that you're interested in. Or if you're interested in more than one reward tier, let us know and we can figure out an additional amount to add to get both. 
Concerned Citizen and Superhero Assist
These tiers come with the exclusive Backer Swag Bag (badge, comic book, name in the program, invitation to Backers Only Panel), plus your badge gets you admission into the con. The Concerned Citizen Badge gets you in for one day. The Superhero Assist Badge gets you in for both days. You're not only helping us out, but you're also getting a sweet deal, considering that regular admission to Awesome Con for one day will be $30 and 2 days will be $50. 
EDIT: We've also added a few more variations of the Superhero Assist reward. We've got the Superhero Assist + T-Shirt for only $10 more, and also a 2-Pack and 4-Pack of the Superhero Assist + T-Shirt. Admirer of Art Superpowers is a new reward tier that's the same as Superhero Assist + T-Shirt, but you get original artwork (not a print, an original!!). You can also add the original art to any other reward tier by adding $50 to your pledge and sending us a note about it. 
Concerned Citizen and Superhero Assist Early Birds
These are the same as above but if you jump on early you get free exclusive comics. Concerned Citizens get the Awesome Con Variant Regular Show #1 from BOOM! Studios, and Superhero Assistants get the Awesome Con VIP Exclusive Adventure Time #15. They ship out within 6 weeks of the end of the campaign.
Art Superpowers
If you've been splashed by radiation that left you with the Power Of Art, then you might want a table in our Artists' Alley. Backers at this tier get a 6' table at Awesome Con to sell their artwork, first dibs on table placement, and a swag bag with a Kickstarter Backer Artist badge, invitation to the Backers Only Panel, and an exclusive limited edition variant show program with a blank cover so you can design your own cover. Inside that program, you'll also see your name with a note next to it so that attendees know YOU BACKED US! You also get a second badge for an assistant. 
Here's some of 2013's VIP swag bag. With your help, 2014's will be even better!!
Sidekick, Vigilante, Superhero, and Omnipotent Super-Being
These tiers are kind of like VIP passes. Except they're better. And they offer rewards never before seen at a comic-con. At the Sidekick tier, you get an extra-sweet gift bag with the entire contents of the Superhero Assist reward, plus a coupon for free photo-op & autograph from a media guest (your choice), an exclusive comic or toy, and an exclusive t-shirt. You'll also get Sidekick benefits like early entry into the con and priority panel seating. At the Vigilante tier, you get all the same rewards and benefits of a Sidekick, but you'll also be invited to a catered party after the con on Saturday, where you get free food and you schmooze with staff and maybe some guests. At the Superhero tier, things start to get serious. If you are a Superhero, you have the ability to cut the line at every panel, and you can cut the line for autographs for every media guest (once per guest). We'll also mail you out a copy of every exclusive comic we've ever done for a con up to now (Adventure Time #1, Marceline #1, Revival #1, Doctor Who #1, Fionna & Cake #1, Adventure Time #15, Regular Show #1, Candy Capers #1, and TMNT: Animated Adventures #1), and a special 2013 Awesome Con program signed by 10 guests. At the Omnipitent Super-Being tier, your life changes. We basically treat you like a celebrity. You get a hotel room, you get all your meals covered, you get first dibs on everything. You can get into the green room and drink soda and eat sandwiches with some guests and staff. If there is a panel going on, and the room is full, we will make somebody leave so that you can go in. This is the level of access you get at this tier, and that's why there's only one available. Only select this reward if you are prepared to act like an absolute diva all weekend (just kidding, but seriously, you deserve it. TREAT YO SELF). 
The Crossover Event of the Century
Some people dream of a fairy tale wedding. Some people dream of a geek wedding at a comic-con. This reward is for the latter. Here are the basics: You and your fiancé will get VIP treatment at Awesome Con 2014, including all the Sidekick rewards, plus two-nights' hotel stay (separate rooms Friday night, honeymoon suite Saturday). You also get a wedding ceremony and a reception for 50 guests at the show. That includes officiant, DJ, and catering. If you want to bring your own officiant, be my guest. We can go over the little details later, this is YOUR special day so we will make sure you have input on everything like the color of tablecloths and all that. Your guests will be allowed into the ceremony/reception without Awesome Con admission. Look, your new mother in-law just isn't into comic-cons, we get it. She can still come to the wedding.
Secret Identity, Scientific Genius, Benevolent Industrial Titan, and Super-Spy Boss
These reward tiers are for exhibitors. If you'd like an exhibitor booth or booths at Awesome Con DC, you can choose from these four options. Exhibitors who back our Kickstarter get absolute first dibs on the placement of their booths. This is your chance to be one of the very first booths that attendees see as they walk into Awesome Con. These reward tiers also come with a swag bag which includes a Kickstarter Backer Exhibitor badge, invitation to the Backers Only Panel, and an exclusive limited edition variant show program with a blank cover. Inside that program, you'll also see your name with a note next to it so that attendees know YOU BACKED US! You also get two additional badges per booth. Backers get dibs on booth placement over people who purchase booths after this campaign ends (plus regular rates for booths go up $150 per booth when the campaign ends). Secret Identity is one 10'x10' interior booth. Scientific Genius is one 10'x10' corner booth. Benevolent Industrial Titan is 20'x10', one interior and one corner booth. Super-Spy Boss is a 20'x10' endcap, two corner spaces.
If you'd like more space than one or two booths, please contact us to determine the correct pledge amount for what you want. 
This was the 2013 Exclusive T-Shirt. How cool will 2014's look??
New Reward Tiers
We added a few new reward tiers, here's some more info. 
Helpful Space Alien
For people who can't make it to the con; you get a downloadable Backers Badge that looks just like our admission badges, with EXCLUSIVE ARTWORK just for this tier! You'll also get an invite to a live stream of the Backers Only Panel (or if you end up purchasing a ticket later, you can come in person!). 
Former Animal Now Mutated Into Human Size With Human IntelligenceThis reward is the same as the Helpful Space Alien reward, but you also get a copy of our exclusive TMNT: New Animated Adventures SDCC Exclusive comic book. If you want any copies of the other exclusives we've got (Fionna & Cake #1, Adventure Time #15, Regular Show #1, Candy Capers #1), just add another $15 to your reward level and send us a note.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This far out, there are still a lot of unknowns and there are still a lot of important questions we can't answer. We haven't booked very many guests yet, and the show falls on a major holiday, Easter. Also, nothing of this size has ever been done in DC. But that's not a risk, that's an opportunity. We are completely qualified to make this show happen, and to make it Awesome. The challenges we faced prior to the 2013 Awesome Con were actually more daunting, and we overcame them pretty handily. 

In case you're worried, we are already in touch with the representatives of dozens of guests, and we'll stay in touch, so we should have guest confirmations as soon as the potential guests know what their film schedules are like in April 2014. The guest list WILL be fantastic, don't worry about that. If you look at other major cons around the country, 4-6 months beforehand is when they really start announcing guests, and we'll also probably keep adding guests up until a few weeks before the con.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Help back my new con - Star Con in Orlando, Florida
updates.update_content:
After Awesome Con 2014, I was pretty sure that was the last Kickstarter campaign I'd ever run. Well, here we are again...
Actually, I'm VERY excited for my new project, Star Con! This will be a different kind of event from Awesome Con, it's a more intimate hotel con that is based more on panels and social events. If you think it's a cool idea, hopefully you can make it to Star Con next year! It's September 25-27 at the Doubletree hotel across from Universal Orlando Resort. We've also got a few backer levels for people who aren't able to make it to the con but would like some of the swag. Feel free to reach out to me if you have any questions/suggestions or if it seems like I've left anything out.

We're coming up on 5 years since the con we created with this Kickstarter project. I'm overwhelmed with how big Awesome Con has become since then. Back then I basically ran the entire show with two employees. Now there are probably 30-40 people working full-time to make this event happen and I'm just a part of it. 
I just want to formally invite you to Awesome Con #7, April 26-28 (NEXT WEEKEND!), I really can't wait to see you there. Also, get your tickets ASAP (prices go up on April 21st). If you see me, please stop me and say hi. I will also be at the Awesome Con Avengers: Engame IMAX screening at the Air and Space Museum on Thursday night, which means if you see me at the con I will be happy to geek out with you about Endgame.

I just want to send out this quick reminder that Awesome Con is June 16-18, I hope I see all of our Backers there! We've got some really cool stuff happening this year, from Stan Lee, David Tennant, Future Con with Smithsonian, this is some really great stuff, and there are still more announcements yet to come! 
In Backer news, I know we've been doing the Backers panel every year since 2014, but this year, I'm doing a panel called "Celebrating Five Years of Awesomeness" that everyone is invited to. I STILL want all of our Backers at this panel, it's going to be a great time!! I'm not sure exactly what we'll be doing, but it's going to be fun!!

I was just alerted that this campaign officially ended three years ago today, so I just wanted to post a quick update. I can't believe it's been three years already! I want to send an extra thank you to all of you and to let you know that I continue to work hard every day to make this show as awesome as possible. In fact, I'm spending part of today working on booking two of our most requested guests for 2017! I wish I could say more, but I've got a feeling that we are going to pull off something pretty amazing for next year :D
Thanks again and again, I don't know where we'd be without your support!

Hey guys, just wanted to send this update now because I'll be too busy to send one next week. I'm so psyched for Awesome Con, and I hope you are too! Here are the important details, let me know if you have any questions!! Also, I'm doing another panel for Backers, it's going to be Friday at 2:15 PM in room 145B. You better be there!! 
Hours: 
Friday 12 PM - 8 PM
Saturday 10 AM - 7 PM (VIPs get in 30 minutes early)
Sunday 10 AM - 5 PM (VIPs get in 30 minutes early)

updates.update_userinfo: Awesome Con 2016 Update - Things are moving along nicely...
updates.update_content:
Hey guys, I just wanted to send out an update before the con, and it looks like things are about to get crazy for me so I'm doing it 2 weeks early. 
I hope to see as many of you as possible at the con, we've got a panel for Kickstarter Backers on Friday at 2:30pm in Room 156. I think it's just going to be me and you guys, no frills! The schedule is online here, our Guidebook app should be up soon: http://www.awesome-con.com/washington-dc/schedule/

I have to make this short, I'm trying to spend most of today hanging out with the kids, but I love you guys so much and I can't thank you enough. The Backers' Panel was great, maybe we can meet up again in 2015 :D
Awesome Con 2014 was a gigantic success and we owe so much of that to the backers. Please keep in touch, and I hope I see you next year!!!

OK, just want to make sure you guys have all the info you need to have the greatest weekend ever. Our Backers Only panel is at 12:00 noon on Saturday! Please be there, it'll be so much fun! You'll need your Backer badge to get in. I'm still getting questions about this, so I'll say it again. Your Kickstarter Backer status gets you in on Friday for free. Just come in and pick up your badge on Friday and you're all set! 
Whether you’re arriving to Awesome Con via Metro or via Uber or parking and walking in, you need to make your way to the front entrance on Mt. Vernon Place, right across from the Carnegie Library (It’s that cool looking old building with all the grass around it). If you get to the Convention Center via Metro, there will be lots of signage pointing you to Awesome Con. If your friends already bought a ticket or if they need to buy a ticket, the room on the right with the big “TICKETS” banner on top of it will help them out. Kickstarter Backers skip the ticket lines and head straight upstairs. There’s also a handy escalator, and an elevator to the left (on your way back to our Table Top Gaming room). There are booths that say “BACKER” and that’s where you’ll get your stuff. Please have your ID ready.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with anything that involves shipping massive quantities of anything to ANYWHERE, there is always the possibility of mishaps in the form of wrong shipping addresses, missing materials, or unexpected delays. PLEASE know that I am working TIRELESSLY on a system that will assure that all of these possible areas of mishap are being covered and taken care of before they can exist. 

This is my first time doing something like this, however with the combined powers of my friends and family helping me out, I know we can make this process as successful as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: MY BOOKS HAVE ARRIVED!!! I'm so happy right now, you guys! Ugh. Anyway, now comes the crazy work of packaging and shipping. Once I figure out the final number for remaining books, ill post it here and it'll be a "first come, first serve" basis, and once they are gone, THEY ARE GONE! I'll be sending out the updated PDF as well to you guys that ordered it. Thank you guys for your patience with this process and now, we can touch the finish line!

Hey guys, so I just got confirmation that the books are almost here in LA, that they should land here at my door this Friday! So Please make sure you have filled out your survey. It's been 2 years, you shouldn't have to wait a minute longer than you need to for this. Lol. I'll keep you guys posted on any changes. Again, and as always, THANK YOU guys for your patience and I can't wait to finally get these books out to you all!!!

Another step closer.
Hey guys, so you should have received your surveys, so fill those out and get them back to me ASAP. I have no idea as to where the books are exactly at this moment. I do believe they are at least in the States, so i would rather get the surveys out to you now than wait until its too late.

On Feb 11, I received a Message from my printer that read...
"Your Project Is Finished!
Your project, order PRN1307-3611, has officially left the factory and begun its journey to you. Your project will now pass through Chinese customs and be loaded onto an ocean liner, on which it will travel to your country. Once it clears customs in your country it will be transferred to a ground carrier and delivered to your door, all of which will take approximately 5 weeks.

Hey you guys, i want to keep this update short and sweet, so, here we go. 
I cant say exactly how much i appreciate the love, the support and the patience that you guys have shown through this process... i really cant, it means a lot to me, and it BREAKS me that the delays have been as they have.

THANK YOU GUYS FOR YOUR PATIENCE!
Hey guys, i just wanted to post an update, that is a preview of another update! lol. Before that, let me just say again, i cannot thank you guys enough for your patience with this book, and with it going on FOREVER, its finally final.
When i embarked on this journey to do a Kickstarter, i have to be honest, i didn't handle it well, and the pressure of releasing a book that would represent me as an artist for a long time to come took its tool on me, and stifled my process and caused me to stumble along the way. BUT! Through the encouragement of you guys and others around me, i got through that crazy place and the result of this late arriving book will benefit you guys in the end.

Hey you guys, just a quick update, this book is obviously WAYYY behind, and I'm sorry for that. All of these delays are a result of my rainless ness an pig headed ness on areas that I thought would be beneficial and/or streamline the process.
