$1,000 gets you...
The internet thanks, the PDF screenplay, the HD download, the DVD, an original storyboard, a chunk of makeup, plus an "associate producer" credit, and you get to come to the wrap party! (Transportation not included.)
$5,000 gets you...
The internet thanks, the PDF screenplay, the HD download, the DVD, an original storyboard, a chunk of makeup, a full-on "producer" credit, an invitation to the wrap party, and we'll put you in the movie! That's why I'm taking pains to surround myself with some seriously talented and experienced people. My crew heads all have numerous production credits under their belts, and I've worked with them before, so I'm confident in our ability to meet the challenges head-on.

The practical effects are the one aspect of this shoot that is new to me, and that's why I've enlisted the help of Blue Whale, an organization with over fifteen years of production experience. 

There will be inevitable setbacks, of course, but this is a serious passion project for me, and I am committed to pouring absolutely everything I have into getting it made.

"We all have scars and each one comes with a story.
Some of us have been hurt more than others.
The fortunate souls, have scars that fade away.
The rest of us, have scars so deep they never heal.
These are my scars and I’ll let them tell the story."- Nicole from RAZOR: SCARS
This product will not be available in stores. Direct from me only at live appearances and this Kickstarter campaign!
Nicole Mitchell witnessed the murder of her father and the abduction of her sister, Jackie. Now an orphan bouncing from foster homes, in and out of juvenile detention, Nicole has been sent to Brighton Mental Institute and has spent the past 10 years locked away, enduring abuse, that cracks her already fragile psyche. Upon her release at age 18, Nicole plans to take matters into her own hands , to extract revenge on the asylum, her father's killers, find her sister and stop the flow of human trafficking within the corrupt walls of Queen City. This book is a dark, gritty goth-noir work of fiction for mature readers, in the vein of Sin City and The Crow. Everette Hartsoe's RAZOR:SCARS graphic novel will be published from Hartsoe Studios and Most Comics (Based on the story from Everette Hartsoe and Jeff Most the producer of 'The CROW')
For the old fans of classic Razor, you will not be disappointed as Everette Hartsoe fleshes out ( no pun intended) Razor's full origin and untold history. New readers will find themselves experiencing a graphic novel unlike anything on the comic stands today.
Everette Hartsoe's RAZOR: SCARS GRAPHIC NOVEL will be a gritty 150+page black and white toned, square bound comic book written and drawn by Everette Hartsoe, co-plots by Jeff Most. WILL BE AVAILABLE IN SOFT AND HARDCOVER! THIS IS A SELF-CONTAINED STORY WHICH FEATURES A MORE EXPANSIVE ORIGIN..THE PERFECT JUMPING ON POINT.

The funds that are pledged will go to the promotion and printing costs of the book itself. THE HISTORY OF RAZOR
I created RAZOR in 1991 as a way to help deal with my depression over the death  of my younger sister ( see bio ). The 1st issue exceeded all expectations, which enabled me to quit the day job and draw comics full time. The flagship title, RAZOR UNCUT reached issue 51, which is a major feat for any independent comic book publisher. Between 1992-99 Razor has appeared in over 100 different publications. Razor and The Crow have a shared history with Hartsoe and The Crow‘s James O’Barr inspired to create the comics due to the loss of someone dear to them. campaign.story:
The Comic
Darien is a gifted 14 year old boy who discovers that he is not human and is part of an ancient war between alien magical races. While he learns of his legacy, destiny and importance to the battle, Darien establishes bonds with new, strange friends and is taught his magical craft of Kishpu.
The first series consists of all of these elements as well as setting up the mythology of the Sarru Kishpu, the world of Eridu and their enemies. We’re introduced to Darien’s three friends – Unura, Tirwa and Anthaar – each aliens with their own powers that become crucial in the end game against their hated enemy, Orasmas Xul Sarrum. We’re introduced to the school – Lambdu Kishpu. We learn of the hierarchy of the royal court and parliament of Eridu. 
While the story starts on Earth, we will be taken to the far reaches of the galaxy, meet new races and discover strange new worlds.
The first StarMage comic run will be released as a six part mini-series but will have the opportunity to grow well beyond as long as you, our defenders of the realm, continue to support us!
The Creators
JC De La Torre (author of Ancient Rising, Nightmares from Eberus, Serial and Continuum Force) teams with artists Ray Dillon (The Last Unicorn, Peter Pan, Game of Thrones, Treadwater) and Franco Cespedes (Asusto, El Hallazgo, Rustlers, Badlands) to deliver an epic creator owned comic series.
The Kickstarter
All funds raised by this kickstarter campaign will go into the production of Issues 1 and 2 of Star Mage as well as fulfilling the rewards. If the funding goes beyond our goal, it will also give us a head start in getting issues 3-6 into print.
The artwork for issue one is completed and print ready, Issue two is currently in production and should be completed by the end of this campaign.
Later in the summer we'll be announcing a publisher that will help us package and distribute our comics. However, these books are 100% creator-owned, there's no publisher's financing. Our Kickstarter goal is enough to bridge the gap and get a copy of the first two issues in the hands of readers this fall!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There was a previous Kickstarter for this project that we cancelled. After the campaign got off to a slow start, we elected to re-evaluate the project as a whole and determine what we truly needed to make this thing work. First was adding Franco Cespedes as an artist with the series. Second was determining that the rewards we were offering were inadequate and overly priced. 

With Franco's addition we were able to cut costs and set this project for a much more manageable level. We also finished the first book and began production on the second. 

Also the guidance of Ray Dillon, who has worked on kickstarter funded projects like Womanthology (with wife Renae), Peter Pan (with wife Renae) and Treadwater has been invaluable. We are confident we'll be delivering a kick ass product to your door (or electronic device).

Other risks: These are creator owned books and as such there are risks in that one of us could have some life altering situation that could delay the project. However, with issue one already in the can and issue two on its way, we're confident that shouldn't be a problem.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

The Kickstarter campaign is over. This story is not.
Adventures on the Tabletop explores board game design. We’ll take you from inspiration to prototype to playtest. We will get into the nitty gritty of game mechanics, game balance, and game theory. From prototype, we’ll bring you into pitch sessions as designers pitch major publishers. We will discover what various publishers are looking for in theme, mechanics, and play.
Your continued support helps.  Please pre-order now.
Click to pre-order the DVD with Extras. Free Shipping in the US
Click to pre-order Digital Download with Extras
Click to pre-order the Blu-ray with Extras. Free shipping in the US.
If you are interested in a sponsorship level listed to the right, click here and enter the amount.
Furthering our exploration, we will then follow the games into the play testing labs of the publishers in both the US and Germany. We will watch as rules are probed, learn how designers collaborate with publishers and experience the extensive playtest and development process from mechanics to theme.
Listen to The Game Whisperer Funding the Dream with director Douglas Morse. And Part II: Kickstarter Lessons Learned is invaluable.
Knights of the Dinner Table include Jolly Blackburn, Steve Johansson, Barbara Blackburn, and David Kenzer. We discussed many things Hackmaster.
For detailed information, please read our updates and check out the articles, interviews and podcasts.
Article about secret Game worlds at Unboxed: The Board Game Blog
Article by Phil Reed of Steve Jackson Games at battlegrip
New podcast at Rolling Dice and Taking Names
Lovely Interview at islaythedragon
Front Page at Kicktraq linked to article at 2ormoreplayers
And another article and interview at boardgamequest
Interview at Initiative: Tabletop
In the movie, we will interview giants of the gaming world including Alan Moon, Klaus Teuber, Reiner Knizia. We talk with independent designers and distributors and discuss how Kickstarter is transforming not only distribution, but game design itself.
Chris Badell of Greater than Games and Designer Richard Launius playtest an alpha prototype.
GREAT INSIGHTS FOR ANY GAME DESIGNER! If you're a gamer,  you'll gain appreciation and understanding for the games you love and you might just catch the design bug!

Make YOUR table EPIC by adding completed rooms to your dungeon terrain!
Mythical Lairs is proud to present our first line of completer dungeon rooms in fieldstone finish, as well as hallway pieces and accessories.
For a better explanation of pledge levels, please visit http://www.mythical-lairs.com/rewardlvls.html. Also, if you're interested in making a pledge, our order form might help you keep track of what you're interested in: http://www.mythical-lairs.com/order.html. Orders will be confirmed with the survey at the close of the Kickstarter.
WHO WE ARE
Mythical Lairs is a new company entering the field of dungeon terrain. At present, the majority of our products are based off of Hirst Arts molds, and while we plan to always offer designs from that line, we hope to offer additional unique designs in the future as well.
** Please note that we are officially licensed through Hirst Arts. Please visit the links page on the Hirst Arts site or go HERE for confirmation prior to sending Mr. Hirst a deluge of e-mails asking if we are licensed.
We have a strong commitment to our customers – one of quality, affordability and sustainability.Each piece that we produce is mixed and poured by hand, and is personally inspected before shipment. While not indestructible, these pieces have been tested by the harshest tests available – a group of neighborhood children. Individual components have been thrown, hurled-you name it, and have proven to be durable. Finally, every aspect of our operation is done here in the United States with products produced in the US.
WHAT WILL BE DIFFERENT BETWEEN THE PICTURES AND WHAT I ORDER?
The prototypes pictured here are just that – models built using several tiny pieces to obtain a finished product. This is where we learn what works and what we like and don’t like about a particular piece. Please keep in mind  the prototypes were cast using an inferior product, therefore you may see bubbling in the prototype pieces that won't be present in the final products. The finished products will be cast from one piece (or a couple of pieces that are then professionally adhered) rather than several tiny pieces. Each piece (barring accessory items) will have a thin cork padding on the bottom to protect tabletops and prevent slipping. All pieces will come with a dungeon gray wash, allowing them to be used straight out of the box or custom painted per your preference.  Please note that all of our pieces are cast from the same custom materials and have a slightly rough stone feel to them.
* All pictured pieces, unless otherwise indicated have been painted and are not representative of the dungeon gray wash. Please refer to the Altar of Sacrifice for an example of the standard dungeon gray wash that our pieces will have upon delivery.
GREAT! CAN WE GET TO THE GOOD STUFF YET??
You bet! Under each picture is a link to our website, showing additional pictures and further description of each item.Please keep in mind that all prices do include shipping within the United States. Upon successful funding of the project, we have determined it will take approximately 2 weeks to obtain the necessary supplies to make the molds. Concurrently with this, it will take approximately 4-6 weeks to make the individual pieces to be used as the model for the molds. There is an extra 10% of time factored in for the "unexpected's" that will inevitably occur. However, we should be able to start producing the items within a 2 month timeframe. 

All casting materials have been tested and determined. The mold making materials have been narrowed down to 2 options, and should the thousands of reviews on these products be inaccurate, it may cause a slight delay in testing a 3rd option. While unlikely, this is a possibility. 

Risks would include possible time delays in waiting for supplies (though the supplies needed do have a history of being in stock. However, if, for example, a natural disaster were to occur, or I were hit by a bus, it would understandably delay things a bit!). While there is an inherent risk with any new business, there is a solid level of business experience to pull on to make this successful. Simply put, I'm trying to start a business. A good reputation earned through the Kickstarter will only help that business, and I have neither the time, money nor inclination to put myself in the position of dealing with legal action! I'm in this to succeed, and I can't do that unless I follow through with what's been promised.

Hail and well met and Happy Thanksgiving to my US friends! 
First off nothing terrible to report. With that being said, I can honestly say I don't know how many times I've had the impulse to throw in the towel on this whole thing simply because it's so overwhelming! Don't worry - that's absolutely NOT going to happen (how else would I get ML up and going if I gave up now - and I couldn't live with disappointing all my terrific backers who have so much faith in me), but I can't say the thought has never been there.

Just to let you know that we had a (thankfully) minor delay this weekend. We had installed a sink in the workshop, and, in the spirit of cheap, quick and effective, simply put a splitter on the water faucet for the washing machine. Works great, have the hose running through the rafters, minimal expense. This weekend I realized that it was leaking from the faucet. The wonderful news is that it was simply a matter of tightening the connection and the leak was confined away from the workshop, computers, and most things that could be damaged. Overall a very minor problem - but the bad news is that it was still an issue that obviously had to be cleaned up and set my production for this weekend back a bit. Add to that the complete useless-ness of any attempts at work today due to mom's surgery, and the bottom line is that this weeks round of orders will go out on Wednesday rather than today. Still making the once a week minimum shipments (hooray!), just a couple of days delayed.

The Haunted Highlands
Upon the bloody northern marches lies a curious Roadhouse. Here are gathered the flotsam of the world: miscreants, mercenaries, soldiers of fortune, adventurers. Dirty Bowbe's Roadhouse they call it, and it's as rough and safe a sanctuary as any will find in those dark and bloody grounds!
Once, long ago, a Kingdom thrived here and the wealth of its coffers flowed across the lands as honey from a jar. From the deep, blue waters of Lake Veyona to the broken crags that overlook the Northern Steppes the King ruled a realm, both prosperous and contented.
But all things must end. And the wages of war and plague overwhelmed the King and his people and ground all to ruin. And the days of the Highland Kingdom are long past so that now nothing but memories remain . . . memories and their shadows.
Or so such tales are spun by the hearth fire at Dirty Bowbe's Roadhouse to any and all who pass through, for that legendary tavern lies at the center of the world.
To the northeast of Dirty Bowbe's lie the ruins of Bortenski and the hazardous wastes known as the Witch Moor. Beyond that, the village of the Ugashtan and further still lay the broken crags of the Mythnoc Cairns where the proud barbarian people once buried their cherished dead. More, there are the trees of the Grove of the Green Man, the Crater of Umeshti, the Fey Wood and Troll Downs, the Free City of Eskadia, land ripe with the forgotten or lost treasures of a realm long passed.
These are the Haunted Highlands

Hey there! Thanks for checking out my project! My names Bradon and I am in love with the act of art making! Currently, I am an instructor, painter and a full time dad! I am looking to create an awesome series on mythologies and other religious experiences. I am a huge fan of Joseph Campbell and his ideas about mythology and religions around the world have totally changed my life and my practice of creative thinking. My pieces I hope to create for future exhibiting and for sale as well. The works I will create will be influenced by many different faiths and religions and mythologies of the world. Since a young age I have been fascinated by Greek and Egyptian myth, recently I have found a deep passion for the stories of the bible and the saints of Catholicism as well. I’m looking to create a series of paintings that are able to engage a viewer not only on an instinctual level but a psychological one as well. My influences include Caravaggio, Rubens, and William Adolphe Borough, as well as many others. These artists I respect for many reasons and hope to achieve their ability to engage their audiences and effect change in their cultures. It is my belief that we as a society are disconnected from our past and each other more and more everyday. I want to bring back that connection we had with our past and present through art and mythology.

I will be taking part in Kicking It Forward which is an honor system where successful Kickstarter campaigns agree to pledge 5% of their profits to other Kickstarter campaigns.
As you can see from my backer history I’m a big fan of Kickstarter. I really believe in what Kickstarter stands for…and that is simply helping out others who have a dream. We all have a dream and sometimes it needs a little push from others to ensure it is fulfilled.
What am I doing?!?!
The name of my art series is Iconic...because to me and millions of others comic book characters such as Batman or Superman are truly these iconic...larger than life characters.
I plan on creating my new art series using digital watercolor techniques. I want to create digital pieces that look like original watercolor painting but with a slight digital twist.

campaign.story:
Vorspiel
Here is a link to a short we created called 'Vorspiel' which is a prequel to 'Drei'. It takes place just before the events of the short we are planning on making. 
We've made this to get people excited for 'Drei' and also to show the quality of a short we can make on a budget of £0... now imagine what we can do with a budget!
"Another job,
  Before it was over a man would be dead, but this was a morbid fact that Adam, David and Elle had become coldly familiar with. They had countless jobs just like this one behind them and they were good at what they did. 
Adam the planner, dedicated to the hunt, 
David the tactician, dedicated to the method
and Elle the predator, dedicated to the dispatch.
Package in hand and location primed they stand on the cusp of another movement in their well oiled machine.
  Nothing could go wrong"
This is a short film that follows three professionals; Elle, Adam and David, who change their usual procedure of dispatching a target in more ways than they should. A character driven piece that touches on the danger in change and the loss of familiarity. 
Our intentions behind this short are to make the viewer question how devastating a change in routine, no matter how small, can be. They will also be left with the question, 'where do your loyalties lie?'
Why did I decide to take the 'Kickstarter' route?
The major factor is that, like most indie directors our worst nightmare is funding! As I'm sure you're all aware, films are a very expensive process to complete and short films are no exception to that rule. Luckily,  I have the location, talent and crew all arranged for this project. Everyone involved has thankfully agreed to take part free of charge! (I know, hard to believe in this climate right?) All we need now is the equipment to make it a reality. 
My DoP and I decided we really wanted to use the Canon C300 along with a nice selection of prime L-glass Canon lenses in order to get the professional, cinematic look that the project deserves. 
How can you help?
This is where you all come in! To hire this camera costs a pretty penny which is why our minimum budget is £1300 but as with many things, the more money we have the better equipment we can hire which inevitably means the better the project looks. We need to make the full target or we don't get anything so any help you can give will be extremely appreciated.
We will be shooting over the course of two full days and the minimum we need to spend to make this happen is:
£400 on lighting
£600 on camera and lenses
£100 on sound equipment
£100 on camera stabilization (such as a portable Jib and a shoulder mount)
£100 on promotional items for pledges
As stated above, this is all minimum. There are better cameras, lenses, microphones, etc, so the more we accumulate the better the end product.
To help visualise this we've also made some STRETCH GOALS (extremely optimistic) which are:
£1500 - We will be able to hire a Matte box along with filters and a follow focus kit. (This will help to improve the overall look of the visuals on the project)
£1750 - We will be able to invest more money into the costume department. (This helps to get the audience engaged in the scenes as I'm sure you all have experienced)
£2000 - We will be able to hire TWO Canon C300's with Matte boxes and follow focus'. (This will greatly increase productivity and enable us to have more footage to edit with by the end of the shoot.)

campaign.story:
History and Intent
Shadowfist goes all the way back to the first generation of CCGs, in the mid 90s. As the Hong Kong Action Movie Card Game, it's stood the test of time and continues to be enjoyed by gamers worldwide. Afterall, what's more fun than cyborg monkeys battling Confucian monks in downtown Kowloon while truck-driving heroes set booby traps for evil, squeaky-voiced sorcerers?
Inner Kingdom Games, hot off the success of last year's Kickstarter campaign to bring Shadowfist back into the mainstream, is ready to follow-up Combat in Kowloon with two great new expansions: Reinforcements and Revelations!
About the Game
Shadowfist is the mile-a-minute, sword-clashing, butt-kicking, Uzi-spraying, boat-exploding, car-chasing, monster-crunching, Hong Kong cinematic action card game that is so epic it would take fourteen John Woos to film and a cast the likes of Jackie Chan, Jet Li, Chow Yun Fat and Michelle Yeoh. And that's just in the first five minutes!
It's widely considered one of the finest multiplayer card games ever made, with a balanced, fun and fast-paced rules set. Combat in the game is played out realistically and all players are always in the game! Unlike other card games, multiplayer Shadowfist is not about elimination or scoring points. Players only leave the game when they run out of cards and the comeback potential is unlike any game you've ever played! 
In Shadowfist, players vie for global domination, by harnessing the chi, or life force, of the world. They who control the chi flow, control life and with it, the world. Chi flow is harnessed through control of Feng Shui Sites. Like the ancient Chinese system of geomancy to help one improve life by receiving positive chi, Feng Shui sites enable their controller to influence regional dominance. This is conveyed in Shadowfist through the win condition of controlling five Feng Shui Sites to win a multiplayer game.
What this Kickstarter offers:
The primary products for this campaign are the two 50-card, non-randomized Shadowpacks that feature a mix of all six factions plus new unaligned cards and Feng Shui Sites.
These two expansions also feature two awesome new mechanics for the Shadowfist experience: Token Characters and alternate-cost events!
Token Characters enter play from the effects of other cards, such as events, Sites, Edges or even existing Characters. They have a designated Fighting Score, a "notional" play cost and are all Toasted when they leave play.
Each of the six factions have a new alternate cost event that features a flavorful and appropriate effect based on the factions' strengths. The kicker is that these events may alternately be played at no immediate cost, with the secondary condition that the player must skip their next power generation phase!
(We're still toying with whether to use a bold-faced ability for the cost reduction or to keep spelling it out with each card.)
Existing cards for Shadowfist will always be welcome in open formats, and players are free to engage the new environment in the non-collectable model at their leisure.
Whether you're a returning player, back from a long hiatus; a veteran Mr. Suitcase who's been playing since 1995 or a new visitor looking for a great new card game where a Barrel Full of Monkeys faces off against Snake Demons and Thunder Knights, this release has something for you!
Rewards
Explore the reward levels for the right one for you, and if you're looking to start off with a great collection, consider supporting the campaign at multiple levels! Just total the amounts of the levels you like and pledge that amount, then shoot me a note letting me know which levels you wish to receive.
For example, if you want one copy of all game releases, plus an extra three copies each of the two new expansions, you want the "Sifu" and "Master" levels. You would select the Master level, pledge $150, then shoot me a note indicating that you'd like these two levels (or just list the items).
Thank you for your support!
Daniel Griego
Inner Kingdom Games

In short, Inner Kingdom Games is committed to providing you quality merchandise to enhance your continued Shadowfist experience!

This is a tale of the Magical Beasts of the Ancient Zodiac and one girl who will change the fate of Earth....
Book 1:
Kaida Suzuki is a fifteen year old orphan who was raised by monks at a secret dojo, hidden away in the mountains. Abandoned on the doorsteps of the dojo as a child, Kaida has grown up with only her Master, Sensei Shin, to call family. Shin has always known there was something special about this girl so he has trained her in combat since Kaida’s first steps. Kaida was living the normal teenage life; going to school, getting teased by other kids, learning martial arts and keeping secret crushes. **** Every backer will be invited to an exclusive Yurt Grand Opening party! We can't wait to share this unique learning space with you ****
The Plan:
To quilt a yurt to use as a classroom for our forest preschool program.  We will construct a 15ft yurt in the forest and then, with the children, watch the four seasons unfold around us.  With each season we will make one quilted wall panel - so that, in the end, we will have a beautiful external wall depicting the four seasons in our forest (with spaces in between for the windows and door).
The end design will be inspired by observational drawings by the children, discussions about the forest around us and my own quirky and playful design aesthetic!  The children will be involved throughout the design process, watching and giving input as the design evolves.
The School:
It started out as a forest playgroup meeting in the beautiful parks of Charlottesville, VA.  With the purchase of three beautiful, forested acres just outside of town we now have a more permanent place to meet. We are now a forest preschool where we play, explore, build, grow, roam, dig, climb and run. We have a creek to wade, an organic garden to water, plants and animals to study and big rocks to climb. But sometimes we also want to slow down and come together as a group to read, chat, create or rest.  We want to build a purposeful space for the group and allow the children to develop a sense of ownership of this space.
"If you don't know where you are then you don't know who you are" Wendell Berry
School is now enrolling for Fall 2013!
Keeping It Local:
We are committed to supporting local artisans wherever possible. 
We will be working with Hal & Asia from Laurel Nest Yurts in North Carolina.  They have been so helpful in advising and planning this project and we are super excited to have one of their beautiful yurts to embellish!
We will work with local carpenters to build a beautiful wooden deck/platform that will double as the yurt floor.
Sustainable Design:
The yurt is in itself a building with very minimal environmental impact.  It is primarily made of wood and canvas.  The exterior quilted wall will be sewn of yet more canvas! We will be building the yurt on a simple wooden deck in the forest.  It will have no plumbing or electricity  - we are a forest program after all!
Where the money will go:
Why so much for a bit of wood and canvas I hear you ask?  It is a LOT of heavy canvas and wood!  All funds raised will go directly to providing the following parts;
* Lots of canvas for the four quilted wall panels!
* The use of an industrial sewing machine to work through all that canvas
* Wooden platform on which the yurt will sit - this also doubles as the floor
* 15ft Wooden yurt frame - basically a lattice of wood and ceiling beams, which gives the yurt its unique strength and shape
* Insulation layer (a layer of double bubble reflective foil) to help naturally regulate the temperature - no air conditioning here!
* Canvas outer walls,vinyl windows and wooden door to let us bring the outside in!
------- We hope that you will consider supporting this creative venture.  The children are super excited at the prospect of building their very own school house this fall.  The nature studies have started and their dreams are there.  Let's make those dreams a reality!--------
Remember, we only get the funds if we meet our goal by the end of the campaign.  If we don't meet the goal then none of the funds get transferred......and no yurt :-(  
Our thanks
So many people have worked together to make this awesome project happen. Many thanks to;
Hal & Asia at Laurel Nest Yurts for patiently talking through the options and teaching us about how to bring our project to fruition
To Nathan Hanley of Sunnyside Projects for helping us work out the platform for the yurt
Estela and her sweet girls at Belmont House of Living Culture for letting us come and video her beautiful yurt classroom
Rich at Jaia Tipis for his beautiful yurt photos
And of course our thanks to you for expressing an interest in our project and reading the campaign through to the end :-)
* If you wish to support us anonymously Kickstarter makes this possible by allowing you to write any name you wish for your pledge.

My idea of how the finished walls will look is probably very different from the design that will evolve with the children. 
I don't foresee any major technical obstacles, however should anything arise we have many resources available to us to get support should we need it.

AS YOU MAY HAVE NOTICED, WE HAVE REACHED OUR GOAL. HOWEVER, WE ARE STILL APPRECIATIVE OF ADDITIONAL CONTRIBUTIONS, WHICH WILL GIVE US A BIT OF A CUSHION AGAINST UNFORESEEN CIRCUMSTANCES AND ALLOW US TO ENHANCE OUR MARKETING. WE APPRECIATE EVERY PLEDGE MORE THAN YOU CAN KNOW.
In the late 1980s Gene Roddenberry and Robert H. Justman gave Marc Cushman permission and encouragement to write the definitive history of "Star Trek®: The Original Series". They backed up their stamp of approval by providing Marc exclusive access to all the production documents generated by the series -- everything from the creation of the idea by Gene Roddenberry to the last day of production. 
Unfortunately, as Marc was completing the writing, he was diagnosed with advanced, stage-three cancer. But, the first volume is ready to go to press and we are raising this money for a much needed marketing campaign to help Marc get his passion project into the hands of Trekkers around the world as soon as possible.
"These are the Voyages" is a three-volume book set that provides stunningly detailed documentation of the creation, production, and post production of both pilots and all three seasons of "Star Trek®," including story development, the writing of the teleplays, casting, set design, shooting, editing and the struggle to complete innovative special effects that were state of the art for their time. 
The set contains hundreds of previously unpublished insights and recollections from actors, directors, producers, and production crew, capturing what went on from every perspective, including memos dictated by Roddenberry while reading drafts to the series scripts. The books offer a unique look behind-the-scenes in the form of original staff memos, contracts, schedules, budgets, network correspondence, and the censor reports from NBC Standards and Practices. 
Gene’s son, Rod Roddenberry, has said, “This is going to be the bible to STAR TREK® and how it was made. This is a book that I’m going to keep near and dear and utilize throughout my life.” 
Here is just some of what you’ll find in the first volume of "These are the Voyages"::
• Hundreds of previously unpublished insights and recollections from the actors, writers, directors, producers, and production crew of the series, capturing what went on from every perspective — including lengthy new material from series creator Gene Roddenberry, privately recorded before his passing and finally made public here.
• A unique look behind the scenes in the form of original staff memos -- including Gene Roddenberry's own memos, recorded while reading drafts of the series scripts -- contracts, schedules, budgets, network correspondence, censor reports from NBC Standards and Practices, and other newly-uncovered documentation. Read about the making of each episode as the episodes are being made, straight from the typewriters of the people who were making them.
• The passionate memos and letters of writer/producer Gene Coon, who never gave an interview concerning Star Trek® before his death, and whose voice is finally heard as his extraordinarily important contribution to the series is fully explored.
• The documented truth behind the writing of "The City on the Edge of Forever," Season One’s most acclaimed episode and winner of the Hugo and Writers Guild Awards. Rumors about who wrote what in this episode have been circulating for years. Now, what really happened and who deserves credit, is revealed at last.  
• The surprising and dramatic story of how Season One’s most criticized episode,"The Alternative Factor," went awry and became a jumbled mess.  
• The actual Nielsen ratings, secret for 45 years, are made public here for the very first time for every episode. (And guess what…they were a lot better than NBC ever admitted!) Transport yourself back in space and time to witness the true history of Season One of Star Trek®: TOS. Go behind the closed doors of NBC, Desilu/Paramount, the producers’ offices, the writers’ room, the sound stages and shooting locations, and learn the actual facts behind all the blood, sweat, tears, politics, and spellbinding creativity that brought Star Trek® into being…and changed the world.
These books have been more than twenty years in the making and embody Mr. Cushman's intense passion for the material and his desire to deliver that material to Trekkers everywhere. 
"These are the Voyages" is Marc Cushman's second TV series bio. The first book, "I Spy: A History and Episode Guide to the Groundbreaking Television Series," co-written with Linda J. LaRosa, with a foreword by Robert Culp, was published by McFarland & Company, Inc. in 2007.
In addition to that book, Marc's writing credits include work for "Star Trek: The Next Generation," "Beyond Belief: Fact or Fiction," "Diagnosis Murder" and "Bachelor Pad."  His feature film credits include "Midnight Confessions," "Teresa's Tattoo," "The Magic of Christmas"  and "In the Eyes of a Killer."

campaign.story:
Hunters of Arcfall is a quick playing dice and card game where players take on the role of Bounty Hunters and attempt to capture the most fame or fortune. Thanks to Kickstarter, we can bring this game to a table near you with an exclusive limited print run only available here. Pledge now and join the hunt!
Update #1 - Dice Information
Update #3 - Looking at the Bounties
Update #6 - Character Lore
Update #5 - Print and Play Files
Update #6 - Add-ons
Update #13 - Kickstarter Exclusive Card!
'Hunters Decoded' Booklet ($5) - A Kickstarter exlusive booklet that contains original artwork, story and design content.
'Tools of the Trade' Prototype Expansion Pack ($10) - creates a more complex Hunters of Arcfall experience for players craving more challenge. A completely optional separate deck of items usable by Hunters to create more advanced gameplay.
Extra set of dice ($15) - An extra set of 13 custom molded Bounty Hunting dice to use with a Print and Play version or to speed a game up by not passing the dice.
Extra copy of the game ($25-$35) - Add +$25 for each additional copy of Hunters of Arcfall to the US or +$35 for each additional copy of Hunters of Arcfall to anywhere outside of the US.
Custom metal dice set ($60) - 13 machined custom aluminum dice add-ons. These lightweight aluminum dice will survive even the most dangerous of prey. These are 16mm carved aluminum dice with limited availability. You get these dice in addition to the standard set.
To get any off these Add-Ons, simply add the correct amount to your backer level, and note that you want one of these extras. We'll send out a survey at the end of the campaign to sort out what you want.
The planet of Arcfall has become overrun with dangerous creatures. Malfunctioning robots and savage beasts wreak havoc across the planet. Locals have taken to the services of anyone who will help. For a price of course. You are a Bounty Hunter seeking fame and fortune. But beware, other Hunters will try to swoop in and claim your target as their own! Press your luck against other hunters in search of fame and fortune!
Hunters of Arcfall is a quick-playing and strategic press-your-luck dice game full of risks and rewards. Some of the features include:
Take on the role of an intergalactic bounty hunter with special abilities
Hunt bounties for fame or fortune
Steal bounties from other players
Experience a Sci-Fi theme with art by comic artist Tim McBurnie
Easy to learn gameplay with strategic choices
Suitable for every type of gamer including friends and famiy
13 unique custom dice

In Hunters of Arcfall you and up to 5 competing bounty hunters will take turns collecting bounties for rewards. Hunt with caution however, as the bounty only goes to the player who deals the last hit. Defeated bounties become captured and must be claimed or they won’t count.
Press forward and keep hunting to build a cache of captured bounties. Use heals to stay alive and dodge environmental disasters. Take too much damage before you claim and you can say goodbye to all your bounties. Hunters of Arcfall incorporates gameplay elements from games like Zombie Dice, Elder Sign, and King of Tokyo.
Thematically, the game is inspired by comics and fantasy science fiction like Star Wars and EC Comics properties. The game’s gorgeous art style fits perfectly with the theme of the game creating a unique tabletop experience that a whole group can enjoy. Tim McBurnie has been illustrating comics and TCG cards for over 10 years and is no stranger to rich Science Fiction settings. You can check out more of his work here and here.
(non-final artwork)
With Hunters, we wanted to capture the experience of Bounty Hunting in a quick-playing dice tabletop game that would appeal to a wide range of gamers. The design of Hunters is based on the popular Press-your-luck genre of dice games but with more strategy and decision making. In Hunters of Arcfall, the dice play a large role in your success but so too does strategic playing and risk taking.
You should support this Kickstarter if:
You’ve always wanted a dice game with a little more strategy.
You are a fan of amazing Sci-Fi artwork
You’ve read the expanded universe behind Boba Fett’s non-death.
You want to support independent game development.
You like games that are easy to travel with, teach and play with a wide range of gamers.
You should not support this Kickstarter if:
You had fun once and it was awful.
You’ve ever been frozen in carbonite.
Deftly capturing a mountainous Titan out from under your “fellow” hunters doesn’t interest you. 


Components: 13 Custom Dice, 8 Hunter Cards, 44 Bounty Deck Cards, and Ruleset. 
Click here to see a visual play sample.
Hunters of Arcfall is a quick playing dice and card game for 2-6 players. A typical game will last anywhere between 15-40 minutes depending on the amount of players and the point limit.
You'll start the game with players choosing a Bounty Hunter to play as. Players will then take turns rolling dice to capture bounties. The bounties are shared amongst Hunters so only the Hunter who deals the final hit will capture the bounty. But beware, only bounties that have been claimed are worth any points. You can claim bounties by ending your turn or continue the hunt and capture even more at the risk of losing anything you've earned. Use your Hunter's special ability to gain an advantage and press your luck if you think it's safe- you never know what lurks around the next corner. 
**UPDATE**  Take a closer look at some of the bounties you'll encounter in the "Anatomy of a Bounty" update. 
The creation of Hunters of Arcfall isn't possible without the help of Kickstarter. The more funding we can get for the game, the better we can make it. As we hit each of these levels, we will provide new rewards to all our supporters at certain pledge levels. You don't need to do anything to add these to your order -- they will automatically be added if you're supporting at a given level.
$35,000
A new hunter arrives! - Every copy of Hunters of Arcfall will ship with a new Hunter.
$40,000
A new Kickstarter Exclusive hunter arrives! - Every copy of Hunters of Arcfall will ship with a new Hunter available only through Kickstarter.
$50,000
Upgraded Hunter Cards -The Hunter cards will be upgraded for every backer. Larger, thicker Hunter tableaus-style cards that will open up room for Heal dice, story text, and more detailed special ability rules. 
$60,000
"Tools of the Trade" Expansion Pack – We are working on an expansion, and backers at BOUNTY HUNTER and above will receive a free copy of it. A completely optional separate deck of items usable by Hunters to create more advanced gameplay. 
$80,000
“Probability Matrix” Game Add-on – A special custom d6 that allows the use of Hunter special abilities more than once but has the chance to overload and wound your Hunter will be added into every copy of the game. 
$100,000
Planetary Expansion Pack – A whole new Planet Deck with new bounties, hunters, and events for players to explore included in every copy of Hunters of Arcfall. The more over $100,000 we go, the more expansive this deck can be!
Why Kickstarter?
The game design is complete but the art and manufacturing is not. We are using Kickstarter to enhance the Hunters of Arcfall experience with the best artwork and high quality components. With enough support, we can hit a value proposition that will make Hunters of Arcfall the perfect addition to a tabletop collection- big, small, or just starting out. As a self-published game, Hunters of Arcfall will not be available at retail proceeding the funding campaign so make sure you grab your copy now!
Additionally, I would also like to use Kickstarter to get input from supporters on design decisions such as the final box size. 
Pledge Levels
Click image to learn more about the process of designing your own card.
Click image to learn more about the process of designing your own card.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
You should know up front that I am not a large game publisher with decades of experience. I've designed and shipped many software and print products, but this is my first tabletop game. There are a lot of challenges in making a tabletop game. The one thing that has remained clear to me is how much fun Hunters of Arcfall is to play. I strive to apply my design and communication skillset to share this experience with other players. The largest challenge will come from production and art deadlines. Based on production, custom dice and gaming cards are common tabletop components and there isn't anything out of the ordinary to cause them to be delayed or unacheivable. For the art, Tim has been a freelancer for over 10 years, and has created cards for the WoW TCG as well as writing/drawing his own fantasy comic series. So he's definitely done this thing before. We are both prepared to put in the time and effort to bring Hunters of Arcfall to a table near you.

campaign.story:
The Red Dragon Inn is a fast-paced, light-hearted card game for 2 or more players.
You and your adventuring companions have spent all day slogging through the dungeon, killing monsters and taking their stuff. Now you’re back in town, healed up, cleaned up, and ready to party at the Red Dragon Inn.
Drink, gamble, and roughhouse with your friends. But don’t forget to keep an eye on your Gold. If you run out, you’ll have to spend the night in the stables. Oh… and try not to get too beaten up or too drunk. If you black out, your friends will continue the party without you… after they loot your body for Gold of course! The last conscious adventurer with Gold wins the game!
The Red Dragon Inn is a modular game with standalone Base Sets and single-character Ally expansions. You can mix and match characters from any of them so you can have the party composition of your choice! Each of the 3 Base Sets includes 4 unique characters, a drink deck, gold pieces, and all the parts for 2-4 players to play right out of the box. Each of the Allies expansions includes a character deck as well as gold pieces and bits so you can add another character to a Base Set (thus making a 2-4 player collection 2-5 players).
Follow the banner below to learn more about the Red Dragon Inn family of games.
You can learn how to play The Red Dragon Inn from the awesome guys over at Team Hypercube!
Update! To help alleviate any confusion over how to ensure that you get all of the new stuff featured in this campaign, we’ve put together the following info-graphic. It combines the Add-On Reward costs, as well as the shipping costs for international backers.
To reiterate: to earn The Red Dragon Inn:4, Cormac the Mighty, Witchdoctor Natyli, and all 4 of the promo drinks:
Backers in the United States must pledge $47.50 and select the Welcome to the Party Reward Level.
Backers in Canada and Mexico must pledge $62.50 and select the Welcome to the Party Reward Level.
Backers elsewhere in the world must pledge $77.50 and select the Welcome to the Party Reward Level.
Backers who are at the Improved Initiative Reward Level are already receiving RDI:4, Cormac, Natyli, and all the promo drinks.
Backers who are at the Whole Party Reward Level are already receiving RDI:4, Cormac, Natyli, and all the promo drinks, in addition to RDI:1, RDI:2, RDI:3, Pooky the Vicious, and Erin the Ever-Changing.
Backers who are at the Retailer Level 2 Reward Level are already receiving 10 copies of RDI:4, 2 copies of Cormac, 2 copies of Natyli, and 2 packs of the promo drinks.
Coming this fall to a gaming table near you: The Red Dragon Inn: 4, a new Base Set with 4 nautically-themed characters. These characters are the crew of the Crimson Drake, a sturdy sailing vessel that our heroes use when their adventures take them to sea. Of course, it can be combined with any previous Red Dragon Inn sets to allow for larger games and new match-ups!
SlugFest Games is a small publisher in a small industry. Even though we have been making games for over a decade now, there are still high risks associated with each new project. As a result, we have been forced to print relatively small runs of our games, usually only 5,000 copies at a time, and this has prevented us from ensuring that our game is available year-round. Long-time fans of our games know that when we sell out, it can take us up to 6 months to get back into stock again, and that isn’t groovy for them or the friendly local game stores that carry our products. Your support will go directly into covering the costs of a larger print run of The Red Dragon Inn: 4 so we can ensure that everyone gets a copy!
With Kickstarter we gain the following advantages:
The infusion of cash we get from backers significantly reduces the amount we have to spend out of our war chest to print new games.
The number of backers we get gives us critically important data about how many copies we should print. (Over-printing and under-printing are both really bad for us!)
Stretch goals allow us to add more cool stuff to the project (more on this below).
Put these all together and it means that we can spend more effort making the games you want to play, and less effort worrying about whether our games will sell.
Stretch Goals are additional rewards that we will be able to provide based on the total amount of funding we receive for this campaign.
Unlocked! $20,000: The Sea Event Deck is an optional addition to The Red Dragon Inn. The Sea Deck is full of at sea encounters to spice up the game. Every copy of The Red Dragon Inn: 4 will come with the Sea Event Deck. You can find out more about the Sea Event Deck on Update #1.
Unlocked! $40,000: Cormac the Mighty will be printed for Summer 2013 (rather than being on hold till 2014). Backers at the “Welcome to the party” pledge level can add Cormac to their reward by pledging an additional $12.50. Improved Initiative and Whole Party backers will receive a free copy of Cormac the Mighty. Find out more about the Cormac in Update #3.
Unlocked! $60,000: Witchdoctor Natyli will be printed for Summer 2013 (rather than being on hold till 2014). All backers who are receiving Cormac the Mighty will also receive Witchdoctor Natyli for free! Find out more about Natyli in Update #11.
$75,000: We have set out to achieve all we wanted in this campaign, but there are still stories left untold! The SFG guys will post bi-monthly stories and adventures with each of the characters until you have had a chance to meet with each of them. Includes the adventures that founded the party as well as introduced their more colorful cast of monstrous player characters!
Add-On Rewards are additional games or other Red Dragon Inn products that you may purchase if your your pledge level already includes at least a copy of The Red Dragon Inn: 4 (that means Improved Initiative Backers and higher!).
You can add them to your pledge by going to your "Manage My Pledge" button on the top right, and increasing your pledge. Add the cost of any and all of your Add-On Rewards to your current Reward Level, and submit that new total as your pledge amount. When the campaign is over, we will ask you what Add-On Rewards you added to your Pledge, and when The Red Dragon Inn: 4 ships, you will receive all of your Add-On Rewards as well. Add-On Rewards include U.S. Domestic shipping!
International backers will need to increase their pledge level by an additionl $5 for each Add-On Reward they add to their pledge. This is a flat increase for each item regardless of whether it's heading to Mexico or Zimbabwe!
Example: A Welcome to the Party! backer and wants to add a copy of The Red Dragon Inn 2 to their pledge. They must click on the "Manage My Pledge" button on the upper right. Once there, they'll need to increase their pledge level from $40 to $75 ($40 for the Welcome to the Party! pledge level + $35 for the Red Dragon Inn 2 Add-On Reward).
Example: If the example backer lived in Canada, they would also need to add international shipping to their pledge. They would follow the same steps as above, but instead increase their pledge from $40 to $90 ($50 for the Welcome to the Party! pledge level with $10 of international shipping + $40 for the Red Dragon Inn 2 Add-On Reward with $5 of international shipping).
That's it! Remember, we'll contact you at the end of the campaign to make sure you get the right Add-On Rewards.
Some special notes about two of our Add-On Rewards:
The Red Dragon Inn: Gambling? I'm in! includes the rules for nine different card games inspired by the world of The Red Dragon Inn, plus the specialized Rogues and Warriors Deck required to play them. These games can be played on their own, or combined with the Red Dragon Inn board game, adding a new twist to a Round of Gambling! To find out more, and to download the rulebook, check out the game page here.
The Red Dragon Inn: Guide to Inns and Taverns is a detailed, Pathfinder Compatible sourcebook that provides you with the ultimate toolbox for designing taverns and NPCs, as well as drinking and carousing in a fantasy inn or tavern. To find out more, check out our previous Kickstarter Campaign here.
SlugFest Games has been selling games through distribution for more than a decade, and we are extremely grateful to the friendly local game stores that carry our products.
To show our support, we are offering two pledge levels which will only be available to brick and mortar retail stores. These two levels are:
Retailer Level 1: These backers receive 3 copies of The Red Dragon Inn: 4 at a discounted rate, about 45% off of retail. This pledge level includes free US Domestic shipping. International backers in Canada and Mexico will need to add $25 to their pledge for international shipping and handling. International backers elsewhere will need to add $45 to their pledge. 
Retailer Level 2: These backers will receive 10 copies of The Red Dragon Inn: 4 at a discounted rate, about 50% off of retail. This pledge level includes free US Domestic shipping. Brick and Mortar Backers at this level in Canada and Mexico will need to add $50 to their pledge for international shipping and handling. Brick and Mortar Backers elsewhere funding at the this level will need to add $80 to their pledge. Furthermore Brick and Mortar Backers at this level will also receive 2 free copies of any of the two allies we unlock. That means if the campaign gets to $60,000 we will send you two free copies of Cormac the Mighty and Witchdoctor Natyli for free!

Backers at these levels will need to contact us directly to confirm their eligibility. Backers who pledge at these levels and are found to be ineligible will receive the next lower pledge level's rewards instead.
Sorry, online storefronts are not eligible for these pledge levels.
SlugFest Games focuses on making games with simple, fun mechanics that are dripping with theme. Our games are designed to be quick to learn, fast to play, but have a surprising depth of strategy. We strive for a certain type of humor in everything we do.
This is our second Kickstarter campaign, and we’re bringing all of our experience from the first campaign to bear.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In our time in the industry, we've seen a lot of issues: art delays, international shipping problems, and even the theft of a shipping truck containing an entire print run of RDI!  We can't guarantee that something like that won't happen again.

However, the game is already nearly complete.  The characters are ready, playtesting is going well, the art is coming along nicely, and we are still on track for having games in your hands and on store shelves by the fall.

This is our fourth RDI Base Set, our second Kickstarter, and our fourteenth game title overall.  So, although there are risks involved with art, production, and shipping (each of which involve factors outside of our control), we still feel confident that a fall release is well within our grasp.

"Blood and Shadows" is an upcoming novel written by me that is in the final stages of the self-publication process. I plan to publish it through Amazon.com's Createspace website. The majority of the manuscript has been written and now the book simply has to go through the editing process, have maps made by me and have a cover done before it will be ready to be scheduled for publication. I am seeking investors to help fund my cost of editing and cover art, mapmaking software, applying for a copyright and applying for ISBNs and paying to have the book actually published along with the various rewards paid out to investors. Anything above and beyond my overhead costs will go toward marketing my book setting up and maintaining a blog or personal website for fans.
My book has already received great feedback from experienced readers of fantasy who have read the beginning portion of the book. During the kickstarter you may view a sample of my work on my blog at www.bloodandshadows.net. I will have the entire prologue from "Blood and Shadows" on display.
As for what "Blood and Shadows" is about, well, it's more than just a story about good versus evil or a quest to save the kingdom from drowning in blood and being terrorized at the hands of a huge organized assassins guild. It's a book about love found and love lost, about death and betrayal. It's about a band of adventurers seeking to stop the nefarious plot of an assassin warlord who, as mentioned, wants to bathe the kingdom of Tar Ebon in blood and rule with a fist of terror. Along the way the adventurers will run across many strange scenarios. We also see things from the point of view of one of the assassins, which adds another level of depth to the book.This book also has magic of varying sorts, based around the concept that matter and energy can be manipulated by the human mind.
My book introduces a world and some major characters that will be pivotal in the coming books within my universe. In this book we see hints that there is more at stake than what meets the eye. The entire future of humanity hangs in the balance and one wrong move can end everything. So the theme of the saga that this book begins is that humanity faces extinction if the people of the planet Tar Ebon cannot unite. The series is about the preparation for the final fight for the survival of the human race.
Also note that for perhaps one of the few times in the science fiction/fantasy genre I plan to make my saga cross-over from fantasy to science fiction (or more like science fantasy) as time advances in my universe. So while my saga begins with a fantasy novel it will end with a science fiction/fantasy novel.
I encourage everyone reading to consider investing in this project. Consider your investment not just an investment in one book but an investment in a series of future books that I am confident you will enjoy.

Kaosball is a fast paced fantasy sports miniatures game of total domination for up to 4 players!
Play as one of 4 great pop culture and fantasy themed teams in this crazy mix of football, rugby and magic and bone crunching action!
Here's a quick and dirty gameplay video we shot at CMON Expo in May, 
Want more info? Here's a 40 minute video going through the game in depth!
And a quick Amazons vs Daemons highlight with walls and scorch, scorch, scorch!
Play is based on a mix of Action Cards, tactical positioning and the judicious use of fouls!
There are multiple paths to winning, from straight up scoring to systematically and brutally taking out the other teams!
We've prepared another page detailing the teams available so far, check it out here
Each game takes about an hour, making this perfect for league play over 1 or 2 game sessions - grow your teams as they pick up more special skills, ringers and cash as you vie for the ultimate prize in Kaosball, the Chalice!
What's in the box?
60+ highly detailed plastic miniatures and counters
Four magnetized Team Cards
Action card deck
The Kaosball field
Dice
The Kaos Ball!
Expected MSRP - $100

The Gotterdamerung Fangs
One of the few teams to exclusively field local players, their opponents are continually surprised by what the Fangs can do.  Their controversial tactic of "recruiting" opponents to their team contributes greatly to this!
New Purgatory Daemons
The Daemons consistently skirt the edges of legal play, often exploiting the loose interpretation of Kaosball's already loose rules, both to win and increase the entertainment value of their games.  Their latest tactic is the spreading of fires across the field.  Their own innate or imbued resistance to flame makes this a hazard only for opponents, and the Daemons exploit this advantage ruthlessly!
Mt Clobberton Ogres
The Ogres have shown both strengths and weaknesses of what some commentators call the "direct" style.  The Ogres have managed to hold their own against more purely finesse-oriented teams that have frustrated similar teams. 
Templeton Amazons
The Amazons are the reigning KBL Champions, doing the double last year of winning both the Chalice and maintaining the best overall record in the league.  Moreover, the Amazon's physicality has forced a number of other teams to change their tactics.  They have not only proven themselves, they've stamped their distinctive style on the game itself.
Ringers
Also included are these great Ringers, who can play for any team (provided you have the cash!)
Panther
"Well it's like I said to my ex; you can look, you can ask, but this just ain't your game to call, sugar."
Panther's ripped up fields across the continent and shows no signs of slowing down.  She's got her pick of endorsements and sponsorships and is the definition of "hard to get"!
The Dragon
"The wind beneath your... AIEEEE!" - Not Dragon
The Dragon is literally just that.  No one knows where he comes from, or anything about his species.  He's never even said why he plays Kaosball.  The fact is he plays, and he plays quite well!
Cretin the Ettin
"I am the greatest player the game has ever seen." "Except for me." "Except for no one." "Except me!" ad nauseum
Ettin as a species are strong, athletic and antisocial.  A few do make their way from the badlands to civilization, with mixed (and often highly publicized) results.  Unfortunately, the most personally and professionally successful of these immigrants is Cretin....
Panda Monium
"You can't touch the Panda!"
Panda Monium is another one of those enigmas inexplicably drawn to Kaosball.  Ancient traditions hold that pandas are sacred, and touching them is a big no-no.  This is quite literally true for Panda Monium, and he's turned this to his advantage on the Kaosball field!
Rewards!
Contribute to the Kickstarter and get Kaosball, the Worstshire Goblins and Kong Bad, a Kickstarter and convention exclusive Ringer!
“There ain’t no AYE in team, but there is MEAT. And that’s you when we’re done.”
-Coach Dru
The Goblins approach Kaosball with the same attitude they approach life: We'll do things our own way.  Worstshire's reputation as a rough and rowdy town with little to recommend it is well deserved. The Goblins are Kaosball’s anarchs, the team who spit on authority and defy convention. Their team power turns the crossfield into a giant mosh pit, and if your runners or bruisers are surrounded by Goblins, prepare to be crowd-surfed right out of the action!
"It's just a game man... Chill out!"
Kongbad is one of the most memorable ringers in the game today, and not simply because he's a huge ape.  His laidback and easygoing approach to life, love and Kaosball make him a fan favorite!
He's made a long career manipulating play to cost opponents points in unusual ways, and he's very good at it.
Optional items
Just the internal components, less the teams, coaches, and rulebook.  If you want to run multiple games of Kaosball at once but don't want duplicates of the 4 core teams and 8 Ringers.
Get any 2 teams for $35, 4 teams for $60, 6 teams for $85 or all 11 teams for $155.
Moonshine Lycanthropes
“Size is nothing. Power and control are everything.”
-Coach Prof
Moonshire is a dangerous place, where any unassuming science major could be moonlighting as a monstrous terror of the night. Enter the Lycanthropes, champion team of this cursed land, who use this newfound control over immense lupine power at will. Bruiser wolf or runner human? Why choose?
St Cloud Paragons
"The game may have changed, but our principles have not" - Coach Z
The Paragons are a beacon of truth and righteousness in the bloody sport of Kaosball. By focusing their team’s collective soul, they can temporarily sacrifice themselves to boost their teammates to superhuman feats and score like you wouldn’t believe!
Salem Warlocks
“Kaosball is magic. Pity for those that refuse to learn.”
-Kid Lightning, coach 
‘Ribbit.’ That’s about all the defeated enemies of the Warlocks can muster after a crushing defeat by these ancient arcanists. While other teams are bound by the petty rules of reality, the Warlocks take advantage of their tradition and heritage, and bend the very nature of the game to their will.
Port Royale Pirates
“The good things in life are free, but the best things used to be yours.”
-Coach Freeman
Hold on to your cash, the Port Royale Pirates have come to Kaosball! With their uncanny ability to loot an enemy player with every successful play, this team can cheat and bribe the ref with near impunity. Can anyone stand up to this combination of flourish and gleeful abuse of the rules?
Stretch Goals!
"Hah! You like that? Don't pretend you're not impressed."  
Zorra’s not happy unless she’s got her team standing beside her and the bodies of their opponents heaped around them.
Get this Kickstarter and convention exclusive Ringer free with every KBL Passholder pledge when we hit this stretch goal!
This is a great looking mini-magazine detailing all the teams in the KBL, in full color!  Free with every KBL Passholder pledge if we hit this stretch goal! We'll be previewing this in PDF format shortly so you can read up on all your favorite teams!
"T-Bone is gonna do what T-Bone does. Kick. Ass."
Kaosball has always been the beginning and ending of T-Bone’s world; if you don’t play, you’re nobody, and if you’re not involved on the business end, you’re less than nobody.

"I never let being dead slow me down.  I've still got all the moves."
Spectre's ability to slip through obstacles, including other players is valuable, but his long experience and keen understanding of the game is what makes him really great!
"Don't look at me. I just played the game; looks like he died of 'complications'..."
There’s just too much money in and around Kaosball to leave the whole thing up to chance. That's when they call in the Butcher, and the biggest problems on the opposing team just ...disappear.

The Santa Ana winds beat the streets of downtown Los Angeles like a boxer on a speed bag. When it gets this hot, I like to cool down at The Cantina Club on Wilshire Boulevard. I come for the backroom poker, cheap drinks and cheaper dames, but I stay for the live entertainment. Tonight was fight night and the joint was packed. The feature fight showcased a local hero, Willie Armstrong. The whole room of shady dealers and hard luck stories got on their feet and roared when a vicious left hook sent Willie’s chump opponent to the mat, but I stayed seated in shock - the big lunk forgot he was throwing the fight.
The next day the Cantina was shut down by the cops after the janitor found a stiff in the boxing ring. The bloody mess of a corpse belonged to “Ratso” Russo, the Cantina’s manager. Word got out quick that he was fixing the fights, and the safe in his office was cleaned out before the law turned up. I wasn’t the only one who got the short shrift last night. Ratso had pissed off more than his share of customers, including the ones in high heels and eye shadow. It’s going to take gumption, savvy, and a healthy dose of duplicity to come out on top of this disaster.
- Tom Bullitt

The Big Fix is a strategic and psychological card game that puts each player in the shoes of one of Film Noir’s most iconic roles. As the Private Investigator, the Femme Fatale (or Homme Fatale), the Politician and more, players uncover clues and trick their friends, all while searching for their enemies’ true intentions. Six roles, five agendas, three vices, and twelve character cards combine randomly so that a new story is told every time you play.
Character Cards
From top to bottom, The Big Fix is designed to play and feel like a Film Noir. Our goal was to create a game which is not only fun and strategically deep, but makes its players think and act like they were a character in a Film Noir. The game emphasizes individual agendas, simultaneous and interconnected player storylines, and temporary alliances driven by mutual benefit - all of which are key themes and motives in Film Noir. Winning at The Big Fix requires strategy, cunning, and a hard-boiled attitude.
Players score points by accomplishing the goals on their Role and Agenda cards, getting away with their Vice, and by trading their points with other players (by trading, we of course mean bribing and extorting). The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.
A Vice (Gambling), an Agenda (Murderer), and a Role (P.I.)
The most common way that players interact with the game and other players is with Moxie cards. Modeled after playing cards, Moxie cards are what make up a player’s hand.
Moxie Cards
Depending on the number of players in the game, each game will take between 6 and 8 turns, or days. Each day has a dawn, day, and night, which comprise the three phases of a turn. Watch our gameplay demo for a demonstration of each of the phases.
The dawn is the first phase of a turn. In the dawn, each eligible player puts a card from their hand face down onto the table. When each card has been placed, all players flip their cards up simultaneously. The player with the highest numbered Moxie card of each suit wins a bonus, such as the ability to steal a clue from another player or to draw a card from the Clue deck.
After dawn comes the day, the biggest and most important phase of the game. In the day, players take turns bidding and battling over clues by playing larger and larger Moxie cards. The winner of a Clue can elect to reveal it for all to use, keep it for themselves, or bury it. At the end of the game, players score about half of their total points by ensuring that the right clues are going into play and the wrong ones end up buried.
After day comes the night, the most deceptive phase of the game. Like in the dawn, each player places a card from their hand face down on the table. Players who played a Savvy card flip their cards up first and chose a target from the players who played either Gumption or Duplicity, attempting to catch players who spent the night satisfying their vice and revealing players hidden traits.
If there are no more cards in the clue deck at the beginning of a turn, the Detective reveals him/herself and attempts to convict the Murderer. After the conviction, players reveal their Hidden Agendas, tally up their points, and declare a winner!
90 Moxie Cards
32 Clue Cards
12 Character Cards
6 Role Cards
6 Agenda Cards
6 Vice Cards
6 Fingerprint Cards

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our biggest risks in this project are related to getting the game printed and shipped to your door without incident, the only parts of the project which we can't completely control. We’re almost halfway done with the art, and we already know the game is great fun. We have quotes from several reputable and reliable printing companies and we anticipate no complications in getting our game printed through any of them. That said, we have never shipped or printed a card game at this large of a scale before and there could be a few delays on our way to a January 2014 ship date.

We may end up adding extra cards to the deck or design a bigger/nicer box, which would result in a higher quote for printing. Since we have quotes from multiple companies, we have a backup plan in place in case we can't work out our changes with one of them. These printing risks are a very small concern and pose a problem only if we barely get funded. Any money we raise beyond our initial goal turns these small risks into new and exciting options.

We fully expect there to be an issue or two when it comes to shipping. Stuff gets lost in the mail, addresses get incorrectly recorded... you get the picture. There’s a lot of factors when it comes to shipping a game which are completely out of our hands and we can’t guarantee that a game won’t get lost in the mail. We will absorb any unforeseen costs associated with shipping (including reshipping lost packages), and have planned for these costs within our quote. Much like with printing, any additional funding we receive beyond our goal will alleviate these risks.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Having established our mold production to a third-party there are some minimal potential challenges related to delivery..

Minor delays can occur due to factors not under our control such as shipping companies and customs for non Eu countries. We are doing our best to minimize the chance of problems and delays as much as possible.

The steps we have taken to prevent such delays are the following:

1) we have already printed the first of our CAD designs and made resin copies of it. These will be shown during the kickstarted to evaluate size, design and strength of our products. It also helped us to make sure the 3d designs were ready for industrial production.

2) we have chosen to initiate our production in a factory with whom we already did business in the past. We had several options but we have chosen one of the most expensive because of our successful previous collaboration and to minimize the risk of delays.

3) we have already paid for the tooling of the steel mold that includes our first theme! We have pictures that will be shown in the KS. This mold will be ready in a few days, and we should get the first test plastic prints while the KS is live. 
 
4) we have already completed the CAD files for the first two themes of our terrain elements and at least another theme will be completed in the next few days, giving us enough room to complete a few more themes during the kickstarter.

Considering the above factors, delays or issues should be very limited if none. We spent several months planning this KS and looked at many variables and possible problems, taking corrective or proactive actions when required.

The biggest challenge is in the number of themes we might unlock during the kickstarter and the delivery time for some of the additional themes resulting from the stretch goals.
